output: The Sonim XP6 is a discontinued mobile phone released by Sony Ericsson in December 2014 with Android 4.4.2 (KitKat) operating system and powered by Qualcomm MSM8926 Snapdragon 400 chipset, featuring Quad-core CPU at a speed of up to 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 along with Adreno 305 GPU for graphics processing. It boasts an IPS LCD display measuring 2.63 inches in size and resolutions of 320x432 pixels, offering approximately 24.2% screen-to-body ratio protected by the device's design with a micro SIM slot supporting GSM/HSPA/LTE technologies across multiple bands including LTE (1, 2, 4, 5, 7, 8, and 12). The phone weighs around 270 grams and has dimensions of 137 x 64.5 x 20.5 mm with a micro-SIM slot that is MIL-STD-810G compliant and dust/water resistant up to IP68 standards, capable of surviving submersion in water for 30 minutes and drops from concrete without damage within a range of -20°C to +55°C. It comes with an internal memory configuration of 8GB storage paired with 1GB RAM managed by eMMC technology. The device includes dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0 A2DP and LE for wireless connectivity along with GPS/GLONASS positioning capabilities but lacks NFC functionality. With a Li-Ion battery of up to 4800 mAh capacity providing standby time of up to 1080 hours or talk time extending beyond 40 hours, the Sonim XP6 also features an accelerometer and proximity sensor for additional device interaction capabilities. Available in black color with a price point around 490 EUR when it was on sale.

The Amoi M33 is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800MHz and no capability for GPRS or EDGE connectivity as per its specifications. Announced in Q3 of 2007, it unfortunately has been cancelled since then without any updates on its launch status being provided. The device boasts a compact body measuring approximately 106mm by 45mm with an estimated weight not specified and comes equipped with a mini-SIM card slot for memory expansion via microSD cards up to the phonebook capacity of 500 entries, along with basic call logging features. It has internal storage limited to 30MB but does not have additional external memory options or advanced messaging capabilities like SMS beyond simple texting functions. The Amoi M33's display is a CSTN screen capable of showing up to 65K colors, sized at approximately 1.8 inches with a resolution of 128x160 pixels and about an 21.4% screen-to-body ratio for its dimensions. Despite having no camera or selfie capabilities onboard as per the specifications provided, it does offer WLAN connectivity through FM radio reception along with MP3 ringtones via a vibration alert system but lacks Bluetooth and USB options such as syncing devices directly to PCs. The phone is powered by a removable Li-Ion 700mAh battery for its energy needs, available in silver color variants.

The Sonim XP3400 Armor is a rugged mobile device featuring CDMA and EV-DO technologies with support for both CDMA 800/1900 bands as well as CDMA2000 1xEV-DO, offering high data speeds up to Rev.A of 3.1 Mbps according to its specifications announced in Q3 of 2011 and released at the beginning of 2012. It boasts a compact size with dimensions of just 126 x 60 x 25 mm, weighing approximately 185 grams (6.53 oz), making it portable despite its robust build that complies with MIL-STD-810G standards and is dust/water resistant up to two meters for an hour under IP68 conditions. The device includes a TFT display of 2.0 inches in size, offering resolutions at 240 x 320 pixels on a 4:3 aspect ratio with Corning Gorilla Glass protection and capable of displaying around 16.4% screen-to-body ratio for clarity. Powered by the Qualcomm QSC6085 chipset, it also has microSDHC card support up to a dedicated slot along with built-in memory storage options like phonebook integration and call records management. The Sonim XP3400 Armor is equipped with basic multimedia capabilities including an SMS/MMS system for messaging, Java capability (though not specified in the details), as well as MP3/WAV/AAC playback through built-in players; however, it lacks a camera or video recording function. With up to 850 hours of standby time and an impressive talk time of nearly two and a half hours on a single charge from its removable Li-Ion battery rated at 1750 mAh capacity, the device is designed for durability along with connectivity features such as Bluetooth (2.1 A2DP, EDR), FM radio, WLAN support through USB and GPS capabilities via a standalone module.

The Blackview Shark 8 is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE technology with dual SIM nano-SIM support and compatibility across multiple frequency bands including all major networks (GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900, HSDPA on the 900 MHz band). Launched in November 2023, it boasts a robust Android Doke OS with version 13 and is powered by Mediatek Helio G99 chipset. The device comes equipped with an octa-core CPU comprising of two Cortex-A76 (2.2 GHz) and six Cortex-A55 (2.0 GHz), alongside a Mali-G57 MC2 GPU for efficient processing tasks, backed by 256GB storage and 8GB RAM with UFS 2.2 memory interface. Its display is an IPS LCD of type offering high resolution at 1080x2460 pixels on a large 6.78-inch screen providing around 396 ppi density, complemented by a refresh rate of up to 120Hz for smooth visuals and brightness peaking at 500 nits under direct lighting conditions. The phone includes dual main cameras with the primary being a high-resolution 64 MP wide sensor paired with an unspecified secondary camera, both supporting HDR video recording up to 1440p@30fps and offering features like LED flash and panorama capabilities for varied photography needs. Additionally, it has single selfie cameras on the back capable of capturing high-quality images at a resolution of 1080p@30fps video recording quality. The Blackview Shark 8 also offers versatile connectivity options with Wi-Fi and Bluetooth capabilities up to version 5.0, A2DP for audio streaming, NFC, GPS, GLONASS, BDS positioning systems along with FM radio reception; it has a Li-Ion battery of 5000mAh capacity that can be charged at an output rate of 33W via wired connection. Available in Galaxy Blue and Scorching Gold as well as Moonlight Grey colors, this device offers dual SIM functionality with dimensions measuring approximately 168.5 x 76.6 x 8.4 mm weighing around 198.3 grams (6.98 oz).

The Sagem my750x is a mobile phone with GSM/HSPA technology supporting bands at 900, 1800, and 1900 MHz, as well as HSDPA for enhanced data speeds up to 3.6/0.384 Mbps on the 2G network. Launched in February of 2008 but subsequently discontinued, it has a compact body measuring 108 x 48 x 11 mm and weighs approximately 95 grams with its mini-SIM slot included. The device features a TFT display that boasts 2.4 inches in size, offering around 34.4% screen-to-body ratio capable of showing up to 320x240 pixels resolution and supports 65K colors. It includes an onboard microSD card slot for additional storage needs along with the ability to store contacts within its phonebook system. The main camera is a single lens setup offering 3.15 MP, complemented by LED flash functionality but lacks video recording capabilities; meanwhile, it has VGA quality videocall capability and supports SMS/MMS messaging along with instant messaging services. Sound output relies on the device's built-in loudspeaker while vibration provides haptic feedback for alerts—it does not have a 3.5mm jack or WLAN connectivity, but it includes Bluetooth and has FM radio stereo reception capabilities along with Java support in its browser functions (WAP2.0/xHTML) and games playback options through MIDP 2.0 for music player use.

The Telit T410 is a discontinued GSM mobile device with technology supporting both GSM and Class 8 GPRS capabilities across bands of 900/1800 MHz but lacks EDGE connectivity. Announced in Q1 of 2005, it has dimensions of 52 x 57 x 23 mm and weighs approximately 76 grams with a mini-SIM card integration for data services. It features a TFT display capable of showing up to 65K colors on a resolution of 128x160 pixels, along with an OLED second screen that supports downloadable animations and video recording in VGA quality at 96 x 64 pixels. The device comes equipped with a single-camera module offering VGA resolution for stills or video capture up to 300 entries can be stored in the phonebook, along with memory space allocated for call records of received and missed calls alike. Despite its basic specifications including no built-in WLAN, Bluetooth connectivity, positioning services, radio communication, USB port, or audio jack, it does offer SMS, EMS, MMS messaging capabilities through a Java platform with integrated browser support for WAP 1.2.1 and can play games as well as utilize features like video player, photo editor, predictive text input, and organizer functions. The T410 is powered by a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 650mAh with up to 100 hours of standby time and can last for about two hours on talk time before requiring a recharge. Available in black color, the device's specifications suggest it was designed as an entry-level phone during its launch period.

The Nokia 106 (2023) model features a TFT LCD display with 120x160 pixel resolution and supports up to 65K colors on its screen which measures approximately 1.8 inches in size, accounting for roughly 17.6% of the device' extrusion area relative to body dimensions (115.1 x 49.4 x 14.5 mm). It is equipped with a Li-Ion battery rated at 1000mAh and offers wireless FM radio capabilities for communication without relying on WLAN, Bluetooth, NFC or USB connectivity options. The device supports GSM technology operating within the bands of 900/1800 MHz with dual-SIM functionality (either a single mini SIM card slot or two standby minis), and includes basic mobile services like call records management through its phonebook feature, as well as audio playback via an integrated MP3 player. Weighing in at 79.4 grams, the Nokia 106 (2023) is available for around 80 EUR with color options including Red Terracotta and Emerald Green. Notably absent are camera specifications or advanced connectivity features like Bluetooth; however, it does have a microSDHC card slot to expand memory capacity as needed by the user's preferences. The device was announced in May 2023 with its release following shortly after on May 22nd of that year.

The Sendo S330 is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800 MHz and Class 8 GPRS connectivity but lacks EDGE capability. It was announced in the fourth quarter of 2003 before being discontinued later on. The device measures approximately 108 x 47 x 21 mm with a weight of about 81 grams and utilizes a mini-SIM card for connectivity needs. Its display is CSTN, supporting up to 4096 colors without specified size or resolution details provided in the data; it also features soft keys along with downloadable icons capability. The phone comes equipped with approximately 500 lines of memory and can handle about 10 received calls as well as misses, alongside space for 20 short messages. Despite its discontinuation status, at one point in time the Sendo S330 had a removable Li-Ion battery providing up to 480 hours of standby time or up to 7 hours of talk time per charge and operated on WAP 1.2.1 for web browsing with support for six preloaded languages, although Java functionality was not included in this model.

The Sonim XP8 is a versatile mobile phone released by Sony Ericsson with Android 7.0 (Nougat) operating system and powered by Qualcomm SDM630 Snapdragon 630 chipset clocked at up to 2.2 GHz, featuring an octa-core CPU of Cortex-A53 cores and Adreno 508 GPU for efficient graphics processing. It boasts a large internal storage capacity with 64GB and comes equipped with 4GB RAM via microSDXC card slot expansion. The device's display is sizable at 5.0 inches, offering high resolution of 1080x1920 pixels in an IPS LCD format protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 3 for durability and clarity. With dual Nano-SIM slots supporting multiple bands including various generations of networks from GSM to the latest LTE, it ensures wide connectivity options with speeds up to HSPA+ at 42.2/5.76 Mbps or LTE Advanced downlinking reaching Cat12 for peak rates around 600Mbps under certain conditions. The Sonim XP8 is also designed with robustness in mind, featuring a dust-proof and water-resistant body rated to IP69 standards as per the military standard MIL-STD-810G testing. Additionally, it includes an array of sensors like accelerometer, gyro, proximity sensor, compass, and barometer for various physical activity tracking features alongside a dual camera setup with 12MP primary and 8MP selfie capabilities capable of recording in 1080p video at 30fps. The device offers connectivity options such as Wi-Fi (802.11a/b/g/n/ac, dual band), Bluetooth 5.0 with A2DP and EDR for audio streaming, NFC, GPS, GLONASS positioning systems, FM radio reception, USB Type-C charging at up to 18W via Quick Charge 4.0 technology (QC4) from a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 4900mAh for extended usage times of talk and music play respectively.

The Andy 3.5E2I smartphone features a dual-core Dual-SIM (Mini-SIM/Micro-SIM) setup and operates on Android 4.4 KitKat with Mediatek MT6572M chipset, delivering performance through its Cortex-A7 CPU at 1.0 GHz paired with a Mali-400 GPU for graphics rendering tasks. It boasts an LCD display of 3.5 inches in size and resolutions up to 320x480 pixels, offering around half the screen's surface area relative to its body dimensions at approximately 165 ppi density. The device supports various network technologies including GSM/UMTS with HSPA speeds of up to 21.1 Mbps and is equipped for dual SIM functionality across multiple bands, specifically in the range from 850MHz to 1900MHz. With a Li-Ion battery rated at 1300mAh that can last approximately 260 hours on GSM or up to 8 hours on UMTS with standby and talk time durations of around 18 and 8 hours respectively, the Andy 3.5E2I provides substantial connectivity longevity for mobile use cases. Available in black, white, blue, and green colors, this device also includes a single rear camera module capable of capturing photos at up to 5MP resolution with LED flash support and panorama capability alongside basic video recording capabilities at 480p@30fps from its selfie lens. Additionally, it has built-in sensors like an accelerometer for motion detection, a loudspeaker output through the headphone jack, Wi-Fi connectivity with hotspot and Bluetooth support up to version 4.0 A2DP standard, as well as FM radio reception but lacks NFC technology.

The Cat S22 Flip is a modern smartphone with Android 11 (Go edition) operating system and powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 215 chipset featuring a quad-core Cortex-A53 CPU at 1.3 GHz, along with an Adreno 308 GPU for graphics processing. It boasts dual cameras on the rear: one main 5 MP sensor and another secondary camera of 2 MP located in its external display which measures approximately 1.44 inches diagonally. The device supports various network technologies including GSM, CDMA, HSPA+/EVDO, LTE across multiple bands for extensive connectivity options with speeds up to 50 Mbps on the latest networks and a Li-Ion battery of 2000 mAh that is removable. The phone measures about 119.4 mm in length, 61 mm in width, and weighs approximately 224 grams with dimensions offering an IP68 dust/water resistance rating up to a depth of 1.5 meters. It also includes WLAN connectivity through Wi-Fi standards b/g/n and Bluetooth version 4.2 A2DP for peripheral devices, along with GPS capabilities that support GLONASS and Galileo positioning systems but lacks NFC technology. Priced around 200 EUR, the Cat S22 Flip is equipped with a TFT LCD display of 2.8 inches in size featuring a resolution of 480x640 pixels for clear visuals and comes bundled with dual-camera functionality that supports video recording up to 1080p quality, along with an accelerometer, proximity sensor, and barometric pressure measurement tools within its suite of sensors.

The BlackBerry Leap boasts a modern IPS LCD display with dimensions of 5.0 inches and resolution at 720x1280 pixels, offering approximately 65.7% screen-to-body ratio for an immersive viewing experience. It operates on the robust BlackBerry OS 10.3.1 platform powered by a Qualcomm MSM8960 Snapdragon S4 Plus chipset and features dual-core CPU at 1.5 GHz Krait, paired with an Adreno 225 GPU for efficient processing of graphical tasks. The BlackBerry Leap is equipped with substantial internal memory configurations including a microSDXC card slot and comes standard with 16GB storage and 2GB RAM to handle multitasking effectively. For connectivity, the device supports Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n) along with Bluetooth 4.0 featuring A2DP, EDR, LE for wireless audio streaming; it also has a built-in FM radio and microUSB 2.0 port but lacks NFC technology. The BlackBerry Leap is powered by a Li-Ion battery of up to 2800mAh capacity with talk time lasting approximately 25 hours, ensuring extended use between charges in typical conditions. Available in black and white colors, the device was launched in March 2015 but has since been discontinued; it originally supported GSM/HSPA/LTE networks across various bands with a dual-camera system offering an 8MP main sensor for high-quality photos or videos.

The i-mobile 5220 is a discontinued mobile device with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800/1900 MHz and Class 10 GPRS connectivity. It was announced in 2010, featuring dimensions of 116.5 x 52.5 x 13 mm (4.59 x 2.07 x 0.51 inches) with a microSD card slot for additional storage and supports up to 1000 phonebook entries along with photocall capabilities. The device has a TFT display that offers 240x320 pixels resolution, utilizing approximately 29.2% of the screen-to-body ratio in its sizeable 2.4 inches and capable of displaying up to 5 million colors. It is equipped with a single main camera featuring autofocus (AF) capabilities at 5 MP along with an LED flash for video recording, although it does not have a selfie camera feature. Sound output comes from the device's loudspeaker without a dedicated stereo FM radio or Bluetooth connectivity options like WLAN and A2DP; however, it supports SMS, MMS, EMS messaging services along with Java-based games via MIDP 2.1 for entertainment purposes on the go. The i-mobile 5220 is powered by a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 1100mAh capacity and can provide up to 8 hours of talk time or standby, with options in black, white, and red color schemes available for personalization.

The INNO 78 by Innostream is a mobile device featuring GSM technology with support for both 900 and 1800 MHz bands as of its launch announcement in Q1 of 2004. It has an external display that utilizes OLED to showcase images, videos, screensavers, wallpapers, and downloadable pictures but does not specify the size or resolution details beyond stating it is 128x160 pixels with 11 lines in its specification section. The device comes equipped with a single VGA camera capable of recording video, although specifics about image quality are not provided. Despite having GSM and Mini-SIM compatibility for network connectivity, the INNO 78 does not support WLAN or Bluetooth technology according to available specs. It also lacks built-in memory card slots but can store up to 250 phonebook entries with photo call capabilities along with records of receiving and missing 20 calls. The device includes basic messaging features like SMS and MMS, a browser for WAP services, Java support via MIDP 2.0, as well as games functionality; however, it does not have built-in loudspeaker or vibration alerts nor supports external audio through a 3.5mm jack. The INNO 78 is powered by a removable Li-Ion battery with an estimated capacity of 650mAh and has dimensions measuring 84 x 43 x 23 mm (3.31 x 1.69 x 0.91 inches) weighing around 85 grams.

The Sony Xperia 1 III boasts a large OLED display with 1644x3840 pixels resolution and supports up to four cameras including two main lenses of varying focal lengths for versatile photography. It operates on Android 11, upgradable to the latest version at the time, powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 888 chipset with Adreno 660 GPU and an octa-core CPU that includes a Cortex-X1 core for high performance. The device supports dual standby Nano-SIM cards in its hybrid Dual SIM design, offering flexibility to users who travel internationally or wish to switch between networks. With 256GB of storage and up to 12GB RAM internally, it's well equipped for high-end applications and multitasking needs. The Xperia 1 III is also designed with durability in mind, featuring Gorilla Glass Victus on the front and back, dust/water resistance rated IP68, and a lightweight build of just over an ounce without considering mmWave bands for additional connectivity options. It offers fast charging capabilities up to 30 watts wirelessly or through PD (Power Delivery) with reverse wireless support included in the battery specifications.

The LeEco Le Max is a smartphone with Android 5.1 Lollipop OS and Qualcomm MSM8994 Snapdragon 810 chipset as its brain, powered by an octa-core CPU comprising of four Cortex-A53 (1.5 GHz) and four Cortex-A57 (2.0 GHz). It boasts a large IPS LCD display with dimensions of 6.33 inches featuring a resolution of 1440 x 2560 pixels, offering approximately 79.2% screen-to-body ratio and protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 3 for durability. The device supports dual SIM functionality through Micro-SIM/Nano-SIM slots with a weight of around 7.20 oz and dimensions measuring 167.1 x 83.5 x 9 mm, providing ample space within its compact frame for the included hardware components. Network capabilities are robust, supporting GSM, HSPA, LTE across multiple bands including both sub-GHz (GSM) and high frequencies up to Wi-Fi ac standards with dual band support in WLAN connectivity options like 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac for fast internet access. The LeEco Le Max is equipped with an advanced main camera of 21 MP, capable of capturing high definition video at both 4K and standard HD resolutions up to 30fps, complemented by a selfie camera module that offers still photography in 4MP quality alongside basic motion capture. The device also features dual-band Wi-Fi connectivity with Bluetooth Smart technology for peripheral connections, NFC compatibility for close proximity exchanges of data or payments, and has an infrared port along with a USB Type-C (MHL2 TV-out) interface for multimedia playback. It comes in gold and silver color options and is priced around 350 EUR.

The Amoi E860 is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting both 900 and 1800 MHz bands along with GPRS capabilities but lacks EDGE connectivity as per its specifications. Launched in 2007, it has since been discontinued. The device boasts dimensions of 112 x 60.5 mm by 15.8 mm and a weight not specified on the details provided. It features a TFT resistive touchscreen display with 240x320 pixels resolution, offering around 35.8% screen-to-body ratio in its black body design that measures approximately 2.8 inches across. The phone operates Microsoft Windows Mobile 5.0 Phone Edition and has the capacity to expand up to a microSD card with dedicated slot for additional storage through internal memory of about 50MB. It is equipped with a single main camera module capable of capturing photos at 2MP resolution, as well as video recording capabilities; however, it does not have a selfie camera feature or built-in loudspeaker and relies on vibration alerts for notifications along with downloadable polyphonic ringtones. The phone also supports Bluetooth connectivity up to 1.2 A2DP standard but lacks WLAN capability; its communication is facilitated by a GPS, SiRF Star III chipset without any internal Wi-Fi or USB support. Lastly, it runs on a removable Li-Ion battery with an energy capacity of 1150mAh to sustain usage between charges.

The Posh Equal Plus X700 is an Android-based smartphone with a dual SIM capability and operates on Mediatek MT8321 chipset at a frequency of 1.3 GHz Cortex-A7 CPU paired with a Mali-400 GPU, offering efficient performance for mobile tasks within its internal specifications including 16GB RAM and microSDXC card slot expansion up to an additional 1 GB via the included microSDXC support. It boasts a large IPS LCD display measuring 7 inches with a resolution of 600x1024 pixels, ensuring clear visuals in its ~170 ppi density and maintaining approximately 66.5% screen-to-body ratio for comfortable handling. The device supports various network technologies including GSM/HSPA across multiple bands (850, 900, 1800, and 1900 MHz) as well as HSDPA on additional bands (850, 1900, and 2100 MHz), although it has been discontinued since its release in January of 2017 following an announcement back in September. With dimensions measuring approximately 192.1 x 107.9 mm by 9.9 mm (or about 7.56 x 4.25 x 0.39 inches) and a weight of around 275 grams, the phone is designed for portability with its slim profile. The Posh Equal Plus X700 features both GSM/HSPA connectivity across eight different bands as well as HSDPA on three additional frequency ranges to ensure wide network coverage and a Li-Po 2650 mAh battery that supports up to 176 hours of standby time or five hours of talk time when using the third generation mobile networks. Available in black, silver, and rose gold colors, this device also includes an accelerometer sensor for motion detection along with standard connectivity options such as Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.1 A2DP LE, FM radio, microUSB 2.0 interface, but lacks NFC and a front camera or rear dual-camera system for selfies. It's important to note that the phone has an LED flash feature in its single main 5 MP sensor camera with video capabilities.

The Kyocera Hydro Xtrm (ID: kyocera_hydro_xtrm-5555) is a discontinued mobile device featuring CDMA/EVDO and LTE technologies with support for multiple bands including 800, 1900, 2.6 GHz, as well as dual SIM capabilities preinstalled in the form of an eSIM. Announced in May 2013 and released shortly afterward in June that same year, it boasts a robust build with dimensions measuring 124 x 64 x 10.7 mm (4.88 x 2.52 x 0.42 inches) and weighs approximately 139 grams (4.90 oz). The device is equipped with an IP57-rated, dust/water resistant design that meets MIL-STANDARD-810G requirements for resistance to various environmental factors such as salt, humidity, and thermal shocks. It operates on Android 4.1.2 (Jelly Bean) with a Qualcomm MSM8960 Snapdragon S4 Plus chipset providing dual-core processing at 1.2 GHz Krait CPU efficiency alongside an Adreno 225 GPU for graphics rendering, and comes with Android's latest OS version available during its launch period. The Kyocera Hydro Xtrm has a vibrant IPS LCD display measuring 4 inches in size with a resolution of 480x800 pixels offering approximately 233 pixel density for clear visual experience, and it includes built-in protection against physical damage. Additionally, the device offers connectivity options such as Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth with A2DP, EDR, LE capabilities through a dedicated microUSB 2.0 port for data transfer or charging needs and comes with an internal memory of up to 4GB RAM complemented by a removable microSDHC card slot expandability.

The Energizer E4 is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting bands at 850, 900, 1800, and 1900 MHz, featuring dual SIM (Mini-SIM) functionality for standby use. Released in August of 2022 after its announcement in June the same year, this device offers basic connectivity options with GPRS support but lacks EDGE technology, speed enhancements like 3G or 4G bands and WLAN capabilities. It has a TFT LCD display measuring approximately 1.77 inches across with a resolution of 128x160 pixels, providing around an 18.6% screen-to-body ratio for clear visuals on its relatively small form factor—dimensions are about 115 x 46 x 13.5 mm and it weighs approximately 65 grams (2.29 oz). Powered by the Unisoc SC6531DA chipset, running at a CPU speed of 312 MHz with an internal memory capacity of up to 4MB, this device also includes microSDHC card slot for additional storage and supports call records in its phonebook. The Energizer E4 is equipped with a single QVGA main camera capable of video recording but does not have any advanced sensors or Bluetooth connectivity options like NFC; it only has basic FM radio reception through an internal speaker, 3.5mm audio jack and can be charged via microUSB connection for its Li-Ion battery with a capacity of 1000mAh that is removable to extend the device's lifespan between charges. Available in black, blue, red, or gold colors, it comes at an approximate cost of about 10 EUR and includes standard features like SMS messaging but does not support games or Java applications on its platform with only a minimal amount of RAM (512MB). The phone is available for purchase now.

The YU Ace is a smartphone with Android 8.0 (Oreo) operating system and powered by Mediatek MT6739WW chipset featuring a quad-core Cortex-A53 CPU at 1.5 GHz, paired with PowerVR GPU for graphics processing. It boasts an IPS LCD display measuring 5.45 inches in size and resolution of 720x1440 pixels, offering approximately a 73.5% screen-to-body ratio which provides sharp visuals due to its high pixel density (~295 ppi). The device supports dual SIM functionality with Nano-SIM slots for standby and active use of two different bands in GSM/HSPA, HSDPA 900 / 2100 MHz frequencies. Its main camera is a single 13 MP sensor equipped with an AF feature complemented by LED flash technology to enhance low-light photography, while the selfie camera also uses a lens of similar resolution for personal snapshots or video recording at 720p@30fps. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.1 with A2DP support, and it has an integrated FM radio but lacks NFC capabilities; the phone can be charged wirelessly at a rate of up to 10W via its microUSB port or through wired means using Li-Po battery technology rated for about 4000mAh. Available in Charcoal Grey, Elektric Blue, and Rose Gold colors, this device was announced in August 2018 with a price point around 6000 INR.

The Nokia G310 smartphone features a robust design with dust and splash resistance along with a QuickFix user-reparable feature for durability. It boasts an IPS LCD display of 6.56 inches in size with a resolution of 720x1612 pixels, offering a high pixel density that ensures sharp visuals. The device operates on Android 13 and is powered by the Qualcomm SM4350-AC Snapdragon 480+ 5G chipset with an octa-core CPU clocked at up to 2.2 GHz, paired with Adreno 619 GPU for efficient graphics processing. The Nokia G310 is equipped with a triple main camera setup consisting of one 50 MP wide sensor and two additional sensors (one each for macro and depth) capable of capturing high-quality photos at up to 1080p resolution, complemented by an LED flash and HDR. Audio playback through the device is supported via a built-in loudspeaker with compatibility confirmed on standard headphones or earbuds connected using a 3.5mm jack. The smartphone also includes Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n/ac, Bluetooth 5.1 A2DP and LE for wireless connectivity options but lacks NFC capabilities; it operates on GSM technology with support across multiple bands including LTE (SA/NSA) and is available since its release in August of 2023. The device comes bundled with a Li-Po battery rated at 5000mAh, which supports fast charging up to 20W via Power Delivery technology or Quick Charge standards.

Emporia Care Plus is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800 MHz and includes a mini-SIM for connectivity within its network range. Launched in 2013 but subsequently discontinued, this device has dimensions of 122 x 55 x 18 mm with a weight of approximately 103 grams (3.63 oz). It features a TFT display screen measuring 2.2 inches and offers resolutions up to 176x220 pixels, accounting for roughly 22.7% screen-to-body ratio. The phone is powered by Mediatek MT6223 chipset without an onboard GPU but includes a Li-Ion battery with a capacity of 1750 mAh that can last up to 300 hours in standby mode and provides up to six hours of talk time. The device also has internal memory for storing up to 500 phonebook entries, supports SMS messaging, but lacks video recording capabilities or a built-in camera as per the specifications provided. Additionally, it includes Bluetooth 2.0 connectivity and FM radio access along with standard features like an external speaker jack (3.5mm) for audio output.

The Modu Speedy jacket is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800/1900 MHz and Class 10 GPRS connectivity but lacks EDGE capability. It was announced in 2009, the same year it was released before being discontinued shortly after its launch. The device measures approximately 95 x 45.5 mm with a weight not specified on record and comes equipped with a mini-SIM card slot for memory expansion up to 1.6GB internally. It features an AMOLED display of about 1.3 inches in size, offering resolution details at 128x96 pixels within a 4:3 aspect ratio screen that consumes roughly 12.1% of the device's body surface area. Despite having no card slot or phonebook storage option built-in, it does support call records and has an internal memory capacity of up to 1.6GB for data such as contacts. The jacket also includes a loudspeaker but lacks both a headphone jack and WLAN capabilities; its Bluetooth range is limited to version 1.2 with no proprietary positioning or radio features, while it does have an internal MP3 player/organizer along with voice memo functionality for audio playback up to eight hours of music. The device's battery life allows standby time lasting up to a hundred hours and talk time extending beyond two and a half hours. Designed in red on black color scheme, the jacket has no listed specifications regarding video pixels or RAM size but is powered by a removable Li-Po 530 mAh battery for extended use between charges.

The Vivo T2 is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE technology with support for multiple bands including dual SIM Nano-SIM and standby slots across various frequencies from 850 to 2600 MHz. Launched in October 2023, this Android device is powered by the Mediatek Helio G99 chipset with an octa-core CPU comprising of Cortex-A76 and Cortex-A55 cores operating at up to 2.2 GHz and 2.0 GHz respectively. It boasts a large AMOLED display with a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixels, featuring a high pixel density for sharp visuals in its ~398% screen-to-body ratio design that measures approximately 6.62 inches diagonally and is protected by Schott Xensation Up glass. The device offers versatile connectivity options with Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, dual-band Bluetooth 5.2 A2DP LE, GPS, GLONASS, BDS, and NFC capabilities along with USB Type-C support for fast data transfer or OTG functions. In terms of photography, the Vivo T2 is equipped with a triple main camera setup featuring two wide sensors (64 MP each) with optical image stabilization and a macro lens sensor on one side, complemented by a single 32 MP selfie camera capable of HDR video recording at up to 1080p. The smartphone is designed for performance and durability with an octa-core processor (Mediatek Helio G99), Mali-G57 MC2 GPU, and comes with a substantial non-removable Li-Po battery of 4600mAh that can be charged at up to 66W wired or offers rapid charging capabilities. Available in Black Onyx, Sea Green, and Lavender Glow colors, the Vivo T2 is priced around 280 EUR with internal storage options of 256GB paired with 8GB RAM for extensive multitasking capability.

The ZTE nubia Red Magic 9 Pro features a high-resolution 6.8-inch AMOLED display with an impressive resolution of 1116 x 2480 pixels and supports HDR content at up to 120Hz refresh rate, offering vibrant visuals for media consumption or gaming on this Android device powered by the Redmagic OS 9. It boasts a powerful Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset paired with an Adreno 750 GPU to ensure smooth performance across all tasks, including demanding applications and games that utilize its dual-SIM Nano-SIM setup for connectivity flexibility between GSM/CDMA networks. The phone is equipped with a versatile main camera system consisting of three lenses—a 50 MP wide angle, another 50 MP ultra-wide angle, and a 2 MP macro lens—all featuring LED flash technology, HDR capabilities, and panorama support for varied photography needs. The selfie camera is capable of capturing in 16MP at up to 30fps with HDR enhancement when recording video or stills. Sound quality comes from built-in stereo speakers backed by a standard 3.5mm audio jack, and the device supports fast wireless charging for its Li-Po battery rated at 6500mAh to ensure extended usage between charges. Available in black, Black/Transparent, or Silver colors with dimensions of 164 x 76.4 x 8.9 mm and weighs approximately 229 grams (or about 8.08 oz), the ZTE nubia Red Magic 9 Pro offers a robust combination of connectivity options including Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC, GPS with multiple satellite systems for precise location tracking, as well as USB Type-C and DisplayPort capabilities on board. Launched in November 2023, it comes available at around 570 EUR.

The Qtek S200 is a discontinued mobile device featuring Microsoft Windows Mobile 5.0 PocketPC operating system and powered by TI OMAP 850 chipset with an ARM926EJ-S CPU running at 200 MHz, offering connectivity through Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11b) and Bluetooth v2.0 technologies. It has a removable Li-Ion battery rated for up to 200 hours of standby time or approximately five hours of talk time. The device measures about 108.8 x 59.3 mm with an internal memory capacity consisting of 64MB RAM and 128MB ROM, expandable via a microSD/MMC card slot. Its display is a TFT resistive touchscreen capable of showing up to 240x320 pixels in a 4:3 aspect ratio with support for handwriting recognition on its black stylish body that weighs around 150 grams (5.29 oz). The Qtek S200 comes equipped with two main camera features, including a single-shot 2MP and CIF video capabilities; however, it lacks both selfie camera functionality and an audio jack for standard headphones or earbuds. It supports various network technologies such as GSM (850/900/1800/1900 MHz), Class 10 GPRS, and also has Edge capabilities at the same speed level but does not include WLAN, infrared port, or FM radio. The device is available in a stylish black color for about 250 EUR.

The Kyocera Hydro Life is a mobile phone with GSM/HSPA technology supporting multiple bands including GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 and HSDPA at speeds up to 21.1 Mbps, as announced in August 2014 when it was released that year. It has a compact body measuring 131.8 x 65.4 x 10.9 mm with dimensions of approximately 5.19 inches diagonally and weighs around 4.80 ounces, featuring a Micro-SIM slot for connectivity options. The device operates on Android 4.3 (Jelly Bean) platform using the Qualcomm MSM8212 Snapdragon 200 chipset with Quad-core CPU and Adreno GPU rendering high performance graphics, backed by up to 1.5GB of RAM stored in an eMMC memory card slot for additional storage needs. The phone's display is a vibrant IPS LCD screen measuring 4.5 inches diagonally with a resolution of 540x960 pixels, offering HDR and panorama capabilities along with standard video recording at 720p@30fps quality from its single rear-camera module that also includes an LED flash for low light conditions. It is equipped with various sensors including accelerometer, proximity sensor, and compass to enhance user interaction. The Kyocera Hydro Life boasts a robust 2000mAh Li-Ion battery providing up to 418 hours of standby time or approximately 13 hours and 30 minutes of talk time on a single charge with its microUSB 2.0 port for charging, all while being dust/water resistant as per IP57 standards and compliant with MIL-STD-810G testing protocols to endure various environmental conditions. Available in black color only, this device also includes a smart sonic receiver but lacks NFC capabilities for close proximity communication or mobile payments.

The Toshiba Excite 13 AT335 is a smartphone with Android OS version Ice Cream Sandwich (4.0) powered by Nvidia's Tegra 3 chipset and features a quad-core CPU running at 1.5 GHz, paired with an ULP GeForce GPU for enhanced graphics performance. It boasts a high resolution IPS LCD display measuring 1600 x 900 pixels on its 13.3 inches screen and is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass. The device supports various network technologies, including GSM/HSPA with coverage for multiple bands (GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900) and HSDPA technology for high-speed internet access via Wi-Fi or Bluetooth connectivity. The Excite AT335 is equipped with a dual camera system, featuring a primary single 5MP main sensor with LED flash capabilities along with video recording at 1080p@30fps and an additional selfie camera of 2 MP for various photography needs. It has ample internal storage options ranging from 32GB to 64GB, complemented by up to 1GB RAM as provided in the dedicated SD/microSDHC card slot. The phone also includes a suite of built-in features such as an accelerometer, gyro and compass for motion sensing, along with multimedia capabilities like MP3 player support, photo editing tools, voice memo recording, document viewing, video playback in multiple formats (MP4/H.264), and it has a predictive text input system to aid typing efficiency. The device comes with an internal battery of 1GB RAM capacity backed by up to 38 Wh non-removable LiPo batteries offering standby time for up to 168 hours or talk time for approximately 13 hours, and it's available in a dark gray metallic finish.

The Vertu Ascent Ti Damascus Steel smartphone boasts a robust design with dimensions of 115.5 x 49 x 13.1 mm and weighs approximately 160 grams (5.64 oz). It features a TFT display that offers 2.0 inches in size, displaying content at a resolution of 240x320 pixels with a 4:3 aspect ratio across its surface area which is about 21.9% screen-to-body ratio and protected by scratch-resistant glass for durability. The device supports various network technologies including GSM (850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz) and UMTS at a speed of up to 384 kbps with its non-removable Li-Ion battery providing standby time for up to 300 hours or talk time lasting up to 5 hours on GSM networks and up to 3 hours on UMTS. It has internal storage capacity of around 4GB, but does not have a built-in card slot; however, it can store approximately 1500 phonebook entries for contacts management through its SMS, MMS, and Email capabilities. The smartphone also includes Java support along with WAP browsing capability and offers games functionality while being compatible in multiple languages such as English, French, Italian, German, Spanish, and Chinese. Despite these features, it's important to note that the Vertu Ascent Ti Damascus Steel was discontinued after its announcement in June 2009 during Q3 of the same year.

The Unnecto Omnia is a discontinued mobile device with Android 5.1 Lollipop OS and features dual SIM capabilities for flexible connectivity options using GSM (850/900/1800 - SIM 1 & SIM 2), HSDPA on multiple bands including AWS, as well as support for both HSPA and LTE technologies. It boasts a quad-core CPU at 1.0 GHz paired with Mali-T720 GPU to handle various tasks efficiently. The device has an IPS LCD display measuring 5.0 inches in size, offering a resolution of 720x1280 pixels and maintaining approximately a 66.4% screen-to-body ratio for comfortable viewing on the go. With dimensions of 142.9 x 72.6 x 8.9 mm and weighing in at around 163 grams, it's designed with portability in mind. The device includes an internal memory configuration of 8GB RAM paired with a microSDHC card slot for expandable storage options up to the maximum capacity supported by its onboard MicroSDHC reader. It is equipped with two main cameras: one 8MP AF rear camera and a single 3 MP selfie camera, both capable of recording video at 1080p@30fps quality for high-quality photos and videos. The Unnecto Omnia also includes an accelerometer sensor among its features, along with WLAN connectivity (Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.0 with LE support, a stereo speaker setup for sound output through the device's built-in loudspeaker and microUSB 2.0 port for charging or data transfer needs. The Li-Ion battery provides up to 188 hours of standby time on GSM networks and approximately six hours of talk time, with a total music play duration extending up to 24 hours when fully charged using its removable 2000mAh power source. Available in black, white, and gray color schemes, the Unnecto Omnia was announced in January 2015 and released later that March year.

The P40+ is a modern smartphone with Android OS (version 12 or 13) powered by Unisoc T606 chipset and an octa-core CPU comprising of two Cortex-A75s running at 1.6 GHz, alongside six Cortex-A55s also operating at the same frequency. It boasts a dual rear camera system with one main sensor offering 13 MP resolution complemented by a secondary 0.08 MP depth sensor and can record videos in 1080p@30fps quality, suitable for high-quality selfies or casual photography thanks to its single 8 MP front camera. The device supports dual SIM functionality with GSM bands ranging from 850 to 1900 MHz and HSDPA at the same frequencies alongside LTE bands including 1,3,5,7,8,38,40 for high-speed data connectivity up to speeds provided by both HSPA and LTE technologies. With dimensions of an impressive thickness of 8.9 mm and a weight not specified in the details, it comes with internal storage capacity of 128GB paired with 4GB RAM for smooth performance on demanding applications or multitasking needs. The P40+ is equipped with Li-Po battery technology offering up to 7000mAh and can be charged at a rate of 18W wired, ensuring extended usage between charges. Available since its release in 2023, it comes available for purchase at approximately ₹7,223. It also features WLAN and Bluetooth connectivity along with NFC capabilities but lacks an integrated GPS or FM radio; however, the device does include a USB Type-C port for peripheral connections. Designed in Force Black and Ice Cyan colors, it comes as part of model P683L.

The Kyocera DuraForce is a discontinued mobile device featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE technology with support for multiple bands including GSM (850/900/1800/1900), HSDPA, and LTE Cat4. It was announced in November 2014 and has since been discontinued. The smartphone boasts dimensions of 136.9 x 70.6 mm with a weight of approximately 200 grams (7.05 oz) and is equipped with an IP68 dust/water resistance, capable of surviving submersion in water for up to 30 minutes at depths of nearly half a meter. The device runs on Android 4.4.2 KitKat operating system using the Qualcomm MSM8928 Snapdragon 400 chipset and has a quad-core CPU running at 1.4 GHz, paired with an Adreno 305 GPU for graphics processing. It offers dual microSDHC card slots alongside internal storage of up to 16GB and RAM capacity of 2GB. The device includes a single main camera sensor rated at 8MP AF on the back and features LED flash, HDR capabilities, panorama mode with video recording in 1080p@30fps quality for high-quality images and videos. Additionally, it has built-in stereo speakers connected to a microUSB 2.0 port and includes various sensors like an accelerometer, proximity sensor, compass, and barometer within its IP68 dust/water resistant body that measures approximately 136.9 x 70.6 mm by 14mm with a screen-to-body ratio of about 57.8%. The Kyocera DuraForce also has an integrated Li-Ion battery rated at 3100mAh, providing up to 504 hours of standby time and approximately 17 hours of talk time on a single charge.

The Gigabyte GSmart Mika M3 is an Android-based smartphone with a dual SIM (Mini-SIM/ Micro-SIM) capability and operates on Mediatek MT6582 chipset at 1.3GHz Cortex-A7, paired with a quad-core CPU running Android 4.4.2 KitKat. It boasts an IPS LCD display of 5.0 inches in size and resolutions up to 720x1280 pixels for clear visual experience. The device offers two main camera options, one being a single 13MP AF rear-facing with LED flash capabilities used primarily for photography or video recording as indicated by the specifications provided. Connectivity is robust; it supports Wi-Fi and Bluetooth technologies along with GPS functionality but lacks NFC technology. The smartphone has an internal memory configuration of 8GB RAM paired with a dedicated microSDHC card slot, providing ample storage options for users' needs. Additionally, the device comes in Navy Blue color option and features sensors like accelerometer and proximity sensor along with Li-Ion battery rated at 1900mAh that can last up to approximately two hours of talk time or over a day on standby mode when used sparingly.

The Micromax In Note 1 is a smartphone with Android 10 operating system built on Mediatek MT6769Z Helio G85 chipset and powered by an octa-core CPU clocked at up to 2.0GHz, featuring a Mali-G52 MC2 GPU for efficient graphics processing. It boasts dual SIM (Nano-SIM) support with dimensions of 165.2 x 77 x 9 mm and weighs approximately 196 grams. The device features an IPS LCD display that offers a peak brightness of up to 450 nits, covering an area of about 84.4% screen-to-body ratio with its sizeable 6.67 inches diagonal and high resolution at 1080x2400 pixels for sharp visuals. The Micromax In Note 1 is equipped with a robust camera system, including a primary 48 MP wide sensor complemented by ultrawide (5MP) and macro/depth sensors each of their own specifications: f/1.8 focal length at 27mm for the main lens and respective settings on other cameras. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0 with A2DP and LE capabilities, as well as dual SIM card slots (Nano-SIM). The phone also has a LiPo battery of up to 5000mAh capacity that supports fast wired charging at 18W and reverse wireless charging at 2.5W via USB Type-C connection, with an average weight in the pocket comfort zone for most users. Available since November 24th, 2020, it comes in green or white colors and is priced around 130 EUR.

The Coolpad Cool 20 is a versatile smartphone with support for multiple network technologies including GSM/CDMA and LTE, covering bands from 850 to 3900 MHz. Launched in June 2021, it comes equipped with an Android 11 operating system based on CoolOS and runs on a Mediatek Helio G80 chipset clocked at up to 2.0 GHz for the Cortex-A75 cores alongside 1.8 GHz Cortex-A55, powered by Mali-G52 MP3 GPU graphics processing unit (GPU). The device offers a choice of internal memory configurations with options ranging from 4GB to 6GB RAM and up to 128GB storage space using microSDXC cards. Its display is an IPS LCD panel measuring 6.52 inches in size, featuring a resolution of 720x1600 pixels for sharp visuals with approximately 269 ppi density. The smartphone includes dual rear cameras—48MP wide-angle and 2MP depth sensor combined with LED flash capabilities and additional features like panorama mode and HDR video recording at 1080p@30fps, alongside a single 5MP selfie camera for front photography. The Coolpad Cool 20 also boasts robust connectivity options such as Wi-Fi (802.11a/b/g/n/ac dual band), Bluetooth 5.0 with A2DP and LE, but does not include NFC or a traditional radio module; it has USB Type-C for charging and data transfer at up to 2.0 Gbps via OTG functionality. Weighing in at around 7.1 oz (the exact weight is specified as 199.6g), the device offers dual SIM capabilities with a hybrid Nano-SIM standby system and comes available for approximately 90 EUR, varying by memory configuration.

The ZTE Blade V50 Design is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE and 5G technology with support for multiple bands including both older networks like 2G (GSM) and newer standards such as LTE. Announced in July of 2023, this Android-based device was released later that year, specifically in August. It boasts an IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080x2408 pixels on a 6.6 inches screen and operates at a refresh rate of 90Hz for smoother visuals. The phone is powered by the Unisoc T760 chipset, paired with an octa-core CPU comprising Cortex cores ranging from A55 to A76, along with Mali-G57 GPU architecture and comes equipped with 128GB of internal storage and 4GB RAM. Dual SIM functionality is supported via Nano-SIMs for versatfalty in connectivity options. The device also includes a dual main camera setup featuring one 50 MP primary sensor paired with an additional 2MP depth sensor, both capable of recording video at 1080p@30fps and are complemented by LED flash and HDR capabilities for varied lighting conditions. Additionally, the ZTE Blade V50 Design offers a dual-tone color scheme in Sky Blue and Starry Gray with an estimated price point around 200 EUR.

The Gigabyte GSmart MX (GSmart Mika MX) is a smartphone with Android OS running on Qualcomm MSM8916 Snapdragon 410 chipset and features an IPS LCD display of size 5.0 inches, offering a resolution of 540x960 pixels in a 16:9 aspect ratio for clear visuals with approximately 220 ppi density. It boasts dual SIM capabilities through Micro-SIM slots and comes equipped with Android 4.4 KitKat as its operating system, providing access to various apps and services. The device supports a range of network technologies including GSM/HSPA/LTE (850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 MHz) with HSDPA at up to 11.5/42.2 Mbps and LTE Cat4 for speeds of up to 150/50 Mbps, covering multiple bands including GSM (GSM), UMTS (HSDPA on 900 / 2100 MHz) networks as well as several LTE frequencies. Weighing in at around 165 grams and with dimensions of 143 x 72 x 9.8 mm, the phone has a sleek design suitable for portability. It includes dual stand-by SIM slots to accommodate two different network carriers simultaneously if needed. The device is powered by an efficient Li-Ion battery with up to 3000mAh capacity and can last approximately 20 hours of talk time or up to 320 hours in stand-by mode, ensuring extended usage between charges. Notably discontinued since its release began announcements at the start of 2015 with a full launch later that month, it has been available for several years and comes exclusively in black color.

The verykool s5528 Cosmo is an Android-based smartphone with a dual SIM (Micro-SIM) configuration and weighs approximately 169 grams or 0.59 pounds. It boasts a large IPS LCD display measuring 5.5 inches in size, offering a resolution of 720x1280 pixels with a nearly square aspect ratio (~267 ppi density), and is protected by scratch-resistant glass to maintain clarity over time. The device operates on Android 7.0 Nougat OS and utilizes the Mediatek MT6580 chipset, featuring a quad-core CPU at 1.3 GHz with Cortex-A7 cores alongside a Mali-400MP2 GPU for graphics processing tasks. Storage is provided via microSDXC card slot expansion, and it comes equipped with an internal memory of 16GB coupled with 1GB RAM to handle multitasking efficiently. The phone's main camera has a single sensor rated at 8 MP with AF capabilities and includes LED flash for low-light photography; however, details on video capture are not specified in the specifications provided. It supports various connectivity options including Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.0 with A2DP and LE protocols, but does not have NFC or a stereo FM radio; it also has a LiPo battery rated at 3000mAh capacity providing up to 9 hours of talk time on 3G networks and approximately 288 hours in stand-by mode. The phone is available in black and gold colors, with SAR values indicating low emissions for both head and body contact scenarios.

The Micromax In 1b is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE technology supporting bands for both 2G and 3G networks (GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900, HSDPA), as well as LTE with support on multiple frequency bands including 1, 3, 5, 8, and 40/41. Launched in November of 2020, it is currently available for purchase at around 80 EUR. The device boasts a large IPS LCD display measuring 6.52 inches with high resolution (720x1600 pixels) and offers dual-SIM functionality via Nano-SIM cards. It operates on Android 10 based Go edition, powered by Mediatek MT6765G Helio G35 octa-core processor coupled with a PowerVR GPU for efficient graphics processing. The smartphone comes equipped with dual rear cameras (13 MP wide and 2 MP depth) capable of capturing high definition video at 1080p, as well as an 8MP front camera also supporting HD video recording. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac standards along with Bluetooth 5.0 and A2DP for audio streaming; however, it lacks NFC capabilities but does have GPS, GLONASS, and Galileo positioning systems integrated into the device'sin addition to USB Type-C connectivity options such as OTG support. The Micromax In 1b is available in blue, purple, or green with dimensions of approximately 164.5 x 75.8 x 8.9 mm and weighs around 188 grams (6.63 oz). It has a non-removable Li-Po battery rated at 5000 mAh, which supports fast wired charging up to 10W.

The Ericsson A3618 is a discontinued network-based mobile device featuring GSM technology with support for both 900 and 1800 bands but lacks GPRS capability. It was announced in Q3 of 2001, has dimensions of 111 x 47 x 22 mm (4.37 x 1.85 x 0.87 inches), weighs approximately 86 grams (3.03 oz), and comes with a mini-SIM card for connectivity purposes. The device boasts a monochrome graphic display that shows four lines resolution, along with two screensavers depicting start/shutdown indicators as well as call logs showing 99 contacts in the phonebook with records of 20 received and dialed calls plus missed connections. It does not have built-in camera or loudspeaker functionality but offers vibration alerts, monophonic ringtones through a single speaker jack, and supports Java for messaging purposes along with SMS capabilities without additional card slots. The Ericsson A3618 has an internal 900mAh NiMH removable battery providing standby time between 90 to 155 hours or talk time ranging from 2.5 to 4 hours, depending on usage patterns. Available in icy silver and graphite gray finishes, it also includes features like a stopwatch, predictive text input for typing, profiles management system, an alarm clock function, multiple language support (including English), but does not have WLAN or Bluetooth connectivity options nor USB port accessibility.

The HTC A103 smartphone boasts a robust array of features with its latest Android 13 operating system and Mediatek MT6761B Helio A22 chipset for smooth performance. It comes equipped with quad-core Cortex-A53 CPU at 2.0 GHz, paired with PowerVR GPU to handle graphics efficiently on its IPS LCD display that measures 10.1 inches diagonally and offers a resolution of 800x1280 pixels for clear visuals in various aspect ratios (~74.6% screen-to-body ratio). The device supports multiple network technologies, including GSM/HSPA/LTE with dual SIM capabilities across eight bands and is available since its announcement in July 2023, released later that month. Weighing around 15.52 oz (440 g) and measuring approximately 96 mm x 64 mm x 8.5 mm, the HTC A103 has a sleek design with hybrid dual SIM functionality for versatile connectivity options using shared microSDXC card slot memory of up to 64GB paired with 4GB RAM and an eMMC 5.1 storage system. Its main camera module is single-lensed, offering 5MP resolution photos complemented by a LED flash feature along with video recording capabilities at 1080p quality for high definition imagery or selfies taken in 720p format. Sound output utilizes stereo speakers and the device includes standard audio accessories like a 3.5mm jack, while connectivity options include Wi-Fi (802.11a/b/g/n/ac dual bands) and Bluetooth 5.0 with A2DP and LE for wireless headsets or peripherals; however, it lacks NFC technology but does have GPS and GLONASS positioning systems in place of them. The smartphone is powered by a non-removable Li-Po battery rated at 6000mAh with fast wired charging capabilities up to 10W for extended use between charges, available predominantly in gray or silver colors and priced around 140 EUR.

The TCL 40 XE is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE and 5G technology supporting multiple bands including both US frequencies (850, 900, 1800, 1900 for dual SIM models). Launched in June of this year with Android 13 operating on TCL UI, it boasts an octa-core CPU and Mali-G57 MC2 GPU. The device has a large IPS LCD display with a resolution of 720x1612 pixels at 90Hz refresh rate for smooth visuals and comes in dimensions of approximately 164.5 x 75.4 mm, weighing around 195 grams. It offers dual-camera capabilities on the rear with a primary sensor offering 13MP wide angle shots alongside two macro/depth sensors at 8MP each and shares similar video recording specifications of 1080p@30fps for both cameras, enhanced by LED flash and HDR. The TCL 40 XE includes a single Nano-SIM or dual SIM (stand-by) option with internal storage capacity up to 64GB paired with 4GB RAM as provided by an eMMC 5.1 memory module, expandable via microSDXC card slot. The phone also supports various connectivity options such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth along with FM radio reception; it has a Li-Ion battery of up to 5000mAh capacity for extended use between charges at an estimated cost around 100 EUR, available in Starlight Black color. Additionally, the device is equipped with sensors like fingerprint and accelerometer/gyro combo along with GPS capabilities (though NFC lacks).

The BenQ-Siemens E71 smartphone features a GSM technology with support for multiple bands including 850/900/1800 and US versions of these frequencies along with Class 10 GPRS capabilities. Announced in July 2006, the device has since been discontinued but was notable during its time on the market. It boasts a compact size measuring approximately 104 x 46 mm by 15 mm and weighs around 80 grams with a mini-SIM card slot integrated into its design, offering connectivity options for users in various regions. The device's display is a TFT screen that supports up to 240x320 pixels resolution at approximately 190 ppi density and can render around 256K colors with dimensions of about 2.1 inches across by 42 mm, covering roughly 28.5% of the phone's body surface area. In terms of storage, it includes a microSD card slot for additional memory expansion up to 1000 x 20 fields in its contact list and can store photos with call functionality. The E71 is equipped with an internal RAM size that isn’t specified but comes paired with a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 730 mAh, providing up to 390 hours of standby time or approximately 6 hours and 20 minutes of talk time. Available in dark silver and onyx black finishes, the BenQ-Siemens E71 also includes a single main camera with 1.3MP resolution for video capture at QCIF quality and has built-in sound through its loudspeaker system along with vibration alerts; however, it lacks WLAN connectivity but does support Bluetooth technology up to Class 10 speeds as well as FM radio reception. The phone also includes Java capabilities (MIDP 2.0) and a basic multimedia player for MP3/AAC audio formats with predictive text input functionality along with an organizer feature, although it doesn't have a selfie camera or a dedicated music player app pre-installed on the device itself.

The Karbonn Titanium S19 is an Android smartphone featuring a Quad-core CPU running at 1.3 GHz and powered by Android 4.4.2 (KitKat). It comes with 8GB of internal storage and 1GB RAM, expandable via microSDHC card slot. The device has two SIM slots for dual connectivity options. Its display is a vibrant IPS LCD screen measuring 5.0 inches in size with a resolution of 720x1280 pixels maintaining a nearly square aspect ratio, offering sharp visuals due to its high pixel density (~294 ppi). The smartphone includes a main camera module rated at 13MP AF for still photography and has video recording capabilities. It also boasts dual sensors including an accelerometer and proximity sensor along with Li-Ion battery technology providing up to 2000mAh of power, which supports Wi-Fi connectivity (802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth connection via version 4.0 A2DP standard, as well as FM radio reception and a microUSB charging port. The phone was announced in August 2014 but has since been discontinued.

The Sharp Aquos sense5G boasts a modern Android 11 operating system and runs on Qualcomm's Snapdragon 690 5G chipset with an octa-core CPU clocked at up to 2.0 GHz, paired with Adreno 619L GPU for smooth performance across apps and games. It features a large 5.8 inch IGZO IPS LCD display with HDR10 support that measures 1080x2280 pixels on-screen offering high resolution video playback at up to 4K@30fps or standard definition content at 1080p@60fps. The device supports dual SIM operation, including Nano-SIM and standby slots for flexibility in connectivity options with GSM/HSPA/LTE/5G capabilities across multiple bands ensuring wide network coverage. With a substantial internal storage of 128GB paired to an ample 8GB RAM via microSDXC card slot, it's built for heavy multitasking and media consumption. The Sharp Aquos sense5G is powered by a Li-Ion battery with up to 4570mAh capacity that supports fast charging at 27W wattage rate, ensuring extended usage between charges. Available in Satin Gold or Titanium Black finishes and priced around €250, it's equipped with a triple-camera system on the rear for versatile photography options alongside an 8MP front camera suitable for selfies at 1080p@30fps. Additionally, its robust build includes water and dust resistance up to one meter depth as per IPX5/IP6X standards and is compliant with MIL-STANDARD 810H testing protocols.

The Minu P124 is a mobile phone featuring GSM technology with support for eight different frequency bands (850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 MHz) and includes dual SIM functionality via mini-SIM slots. It was announced in November of 2015 and officially released in February 2016 before being discontinued shortly thereafter. The device measures 112 x 48.5 x 13 mm with a weight of approximately 83 grams, featuring an LCD TFT display that boasts 256K colors and covers roughly 18.8% screen-to-body ratio on its 1.8 inches diagonal size monitor displaying content at resolutions up to 128x160 pixels with a pixel density of around 114 ppi. The phone includes internal memory options, such as microSDHC card slots and comes equipped with both SIM capabilities for dual connectivity along with the ability to store call records within its built-in Phonebook application. It has an integrated VGA main camera capable of video recording but lacks a selfie camera feature. The Minu P124 is powered by a removable Li-Ion 600 mAh battery, offering up to two days of standby time and four hours of talk time on a single charge via its microUSB 2.0 charging port. Available in black and white color options only, the Minu P124 also includes basic communication features like SMS messaging but does not support WLAN or Bluetooth connectivity beyond version 2.1 nor NFC technology.

The Philips S396 is a discontinued mobile device with Android 5.1 Lollipop OS and Mediatek MT6735P chipset as its core system component. It boasts an IPS LCD display of size 5.0 inches, offering resolution details at 720x1280 pixels in a 16:9 aspect ratio with approximately 294 ppi density for clear visuals. The device supports dual SIM technology and has dimensions measuring 141.9 x 73 x 9.7 mm, weighing around 5.33 oz. With an internal memory configuration of 8GB RAM paired with a microSDXC card slot for expansion up to dedicated slots, the S396 provides ample storage and quick data access options. Its main camera is equipped with an 8MP AF sensor capable of capturing video at 1080p@30fps quality thanks to LED flash support. Connectivity-wise, it includes Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.0 A2DP with a microUSB for charging and data transfer, but lacks NFC capabilities; additionally, the device has GPS positioning capability along with an FM radio receiver. The S396 is powered by a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 2300mAh capacity to ensure reasonable usage time on a single charge and comes in black color for easy identification.

The Oukitel WP32 is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE technology supporting multiple bands including both SIM and dual stand-by Nano-SIM slots for versatile connectivity. Announced in October 2023, it was released later that month with Android 13 operating system on board, powered by Unisoc UMS9230 octa-core CPU at a speed of up to 2.0 GHz and Mali-G57 MP1 GPU for efficient processing tasks. The device boasts an IP68/IP69K dust and water resistance rating with additional drop protection, measuring 166 x 81.1 x 15.1 mm in size and weighing approximately 297 grams (or about 10.48 oz). It has a large IPS LCD display of 5.93 inches with high resolution at 720x1440 pixels, providing an immersive visual experience due to its wide aspect ratio and dense pixel density. The smartphone is equipped with dual cameras—a primary 20 MP (wide) lens complemented by a secondary unspecified camera model—and offers video recording capabilities at 1080p@30fps, along with an LED flash for additional lighting in photos and videos. Connectivity options include WLAN, Bluetooth, GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, BDS positioning systems, NFC technology, a USB Type-C port supporting OTG functionality, as well as sound through both loudspeaker and 3.5mm jack inputs. The device also comes with substantial internal storage of 128GB paired with 4GB RAM for smooth multitasking performance, all housed within its IP68/IP69K-rated LiPo battery that offers up to 6300mAh capacity and is non-removable. Available in gray, orange, or green colors, the Oukitel WP32 comes with a price tag of $105.39 USD or £199 GBP as per current pricing.

The Acer Liquid Zest is an Android-based smartphone with a vibrant IPS LCD display measuring 5.0 inches and offering resolutions of 720x1280 pixels in a nearly square (68.9 cm²) screen, providing clear visual content for the user on its large touchscreen. It operates Android 6.0 Marshmallow OS with Quad-core processors ranging from MT6580 to Z528 chipsets and is powered by a Li-Ion battery of up to 2000 mAh capacity, ensuring substantial usage time between charges. The device supports various network technologies including GSM/EDGE (bands: 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900), HSPA+ with speeds up to Cat4 of LTE at 150/50 Mbps, and also has unspecified bands for advanced LTE capabilities. The smartphone comes equipped with a dual-camera system featuring an 8 MP main sensor capable of taking high definition photos and videos in 1080p resolution up to 30fps; it additionally includes HDR functionality and panorama capability through its rear camera setup, which is complemented by a separate 5MP front-facing selfie camera. Available colors are black or white with an approximate price tag of around 110 EUR. Notably discontinued since April 2016 after its announcement in February that same year, the Acer Liquid Zest offers connectivity options such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth (4.0 with A2DP), along with FM radio reception but lacks NFC technology; it also has a microUSB port for charging or data transfer at 2.0 standards.

The Archos Diamond Alpha is a discontinued mobile device featuring Android 6.0 Marshmallow OS and powered by Qualcomm MSM8976 Snapdragon 652 chipset with an octa-core CPU comprising of four Cortex-A72 (1.8 GHz) and four Cortex-A53 (1.4 GHz). It boasts a vibrant IPS LCD display measuring 5.2 inches in size, offering resolutions up to 1080x1920 pixels with approximately 70.1% screen-to-body ratio and densities of around 424 ppi. The device supports various network technologies including GSM/EDGE (bands: 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900), HSPA+ with speeds up to 42.2 Mbps, and LTE Cat4 providing downstream rates of up to 50 Mbps on supported bands (1, 3, 7, 20). It has a hybrid dual SIM system supporting both Nano-SIMs and comes with internal storage options totaling 64GB alongside 4GB RAM. The device is equipped with two main cameras: one single rear camera of 13 MP for high-quality photos, videos at up to 4K@30fps when recording in slow motion mode or standard video quality and a secondary selfie camera also rated at 16MP. Additionally, the Archos Diamond Alpha has WLAN capabilities with Wi-Fi standards including 802.11a/b/g/n/ac dual bands along with Bluetooth 4.2 featuring A2DP and LE for audio streaming; it also includes a fingerprint sensor integrated into its rear, an accelerometer, gyro, proximity detector, and compass in the sensors suite. The device has dimensions of approximately 146.7 x 72.5 mm by 7.5 mm with a weight of around 155 grams (5.47 oz) and comes in black color options; it operates on Li-Ion battery technology, providing up to 320 hours standby time or approximately 11 hours talk time using the GSM network when active. The device was announced in June of 2017 but released later that same year with a weight capacity and dimensions detailed for user reference.

The Asus Zenfone 10 boasts a high-resolution Super AMOLED display with HDR and refresh rates up to 144Hz on select games, sized at 5.92 inches for an immersive viewing experience. It operates on Android 13 OS platform powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 chipset (Snapdragon 8550-AB) and comes with Adreno 740 GPU, ensuring smooth performance for gaming and multitasking. The device supports dual cameras on the rear; a primary 50 MP wide sensor paired with an ultrawide 13 MP camera offers versatile photography capabilities including HDR video recording at various resolutions up to 8K per second, as well as panorama and gyro-EIS. The Zenfone 10 is equipped with a powerful octa-core processor combining Cortex cores for efficient multitasking alongside Adreno GPU graphics processing unit (GPU). It has dual SIM capabilities via Nano-SIMs, weighs around 172 grams and measures approximately 146.5 x 68.1 x 9.4 mm with a glass front panel for durability against drops or impacts. The phone is dust/water resistant up to 1.5 meters depth as per IP68 standards, featuring Corning Gorilla Glass Victus protection and dual SIM functionality (Nano-SIM). With options of internal storage ranging from 128GB paired with various RAM configurations between 8GB and 16GB, it caters to different user needs. Priced at €699.99 or £669.99, the Zenfone 10 offers competitive performance metrics such as an AnTuTu score of over 130,000 (v9) and GeekBench scores above 5,000 with Android v6.0 installed.

The Panasonic Eluga Ray 800 features a robust IPS LCD display with dimensions of 5.5 inches and resolution at 1080x1920 pixels, offering approximately 72.5% screen-to-body ratio for an immersive viewing experience. It operates on Android 7.0 (Nougat) OS system powered by a dedicated octa-core CPU with speeds up to 1.8 GHz and comes equipped with 64GB of internal storage alongside 4GB RAM, accessible via microSDXC card slot expansion. The device supports dual SIM functionality through Nano-SIMs (Dual standby) for flexible connectivity options across various networks including GSM bands at 850/900/1800/1900 MHz and HSPA+ with speeds up to HSDPA, as well as LTE on multiple frequency bands. The main camera system boasts a single 13 MP sensor featuring dual-LED flash, HDR capabilities, panorama mode, and can record video at 1080p@30fps for high-quality imaging and recording. Additionally, the Panasonic Eluga Ray 800 includes an accelerometer, proximity sensor, compass, and a fingerprint scanner integrated into its rear bezel for enhanced security features. It also has connectivity options such as Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth with A2DP and LE capabilities, FM radio reception, microUSB 2.0 OTG support, but does not have NFC or an infrared port; the device is powered by a non-removable Li-Ion battery rated at 4000mAh for extended use between charges and comes in gold with about a price tag of around 10,000 INR.

The Icemobile Gravity 4.0 features Android 4.4.2 (KitKat) operating system with a Mediatek MT6582 chipset and Quad-core CPU running at 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7, paired with the Mali-400MP2 GPU for smooth performance on mobile tasks. It has an IPS LCD display measuring 4.02 inches in size with a resolution of 480x854 pixels and maintains approximately a 41.8% screen-to-body ratio, offering clear visual content to the user. The device supports GSM/HSPA technology across multiple bands including dual SIM capabilities for versatile connectivity options: it operates on both GSM (GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900) and HSDPA networks with speeds up to 21.1/5.76 Mbps, although its network capabilities have been discontinued since November of 2014 when it was released that year. The phone has a sleek design with dimensions of 140.4 x 75.8 x 16.3 mm and weighs around 316 grams, featuring a Micro-SIM slot for easy SIM swapping. It is equipped with an 8MP single rear camera that includes AF (autofocus) capabilities along with LED flash support but lacks front camera specifications in the provided data. The Icemobile Gravity 4.0 also offers connectivity options such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, including A2DP for audio streaming over a distance of up to 7 hours on GSM or approximately half that time on HSDPA networks when used with its Li-Ion battery rated at 2800 mAh capacity. Additionally, the device includes features like IP68 dust/water resistance and comes in various colors including black, white, orange, yellow, and green for consumer choice.

The Panasonic Eluga Z1 Pro boasts a high-resolution IPS LCD display measuring 6.19 inches with a resolution of 720x1500 pixels and offers approximately an 80.4% screen-to-body ratio, protected by Asahi Dragontrail glass for durability. It operates on Android 8.1 (Oreo) system running on Mediatek MT6762 Helio P22 chipset with a dual SIM hybrid setup and an octa-core CPU clocked at 2.0 GHz, paired with PowerVR GPU for efficient graphics processing. The device supports various network technologies including GSM/HSPA/LTE across multiple bands (GSM: 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 and HSDPA on additional frequencies), ensuring wide connectivity options with a dual SIM capacity. The smartphone is equipped with two main cameras, one of which has a 13 MP sensor for high-quality photos and videos at 1080p resolution, while the selfie camera offers an 8 MP shooter also capable of recording in HD quality video. With internal storage options ranging from 32GB to 64GB RAM paired with up to 4GB external memory via microSDXC slot and a robust Li-Po battery providing around 4000mAh, the Eluga Z1 Pro is designed for extended use between charges. Available in black, gold, or blue colors, it was announced and released in October of 2018 with specifications including dual SIM support, WLAN connectivity (Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n/ac), Bluetooth 5.0 A2DP LE for wireless audio streaming, FM radio, RDS recording capabilities and a non-removable Li-Po battery rated at approximately 4000mAh. The device also features fingerprint recognition technology along with an accelerometer, proximity sensor, and compass to enhance user interaction within the smartphone ecosystem. Priced around 200 EUR, it offers a balance of connectivity options, multimedia capabilities, and robust hardware specifications for its range in color variants.
