The Cubot Note 21 is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE technology supporting multiple bands including both SIM and dual stand-by Nano-SIM slots for versatile connectivity options. It boasts an Android 13 operating system powered by the Unisoc T606 chipset, with a robust octa-core CPU comprising of two Cortex-A75 cores running at 1.6 GHz and six Cortex-A55 cores also clocking at 1.6 GHz for efficient multitasking and performance. The device's display is an IPS LCD with a resolution of 720x1612 pixels, offering a high pixel density in its nearly square (~82.2% screen-to-body ratio) 6.56 inches panel that operates at a refresh rate of up to 90Hz for smooth visuals and is backed by an Mali-G57 MP1 GPU for graphics processing tasks. The smartphone comes with substantial internal storage, offering 128GB paired with 6GB RAM via its microSDXC card slot expansion capability. For photography enthusiasts or daily snapping needs, it is equipped with a dual main camera setup featuring one 50 MP wide-angle sensor and another 2 MP macro lens, both supporting optical image stabilization (OIS) along with an LED flash for varied lighting conditions. The Cubot Note 21 also includes essential communication features such as Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac dual bands and Bluetooth 5.0 A2DP LE, although it lacks NFC capabilities but does support GPS with GLONASS and BDS positioning systems for accurate location tracking. Priced at €99.99 or $79.99 depending on the region of sale, its dimensions are approximately 165.8 x 75.9 x 10.6 mm (6.53 x 2.99 x 0.42 inches) and it weighs around 214 grams or about 7.55 ounces, with a glass front panel encased in a plastic frame for durability.

The NEC N500iS is a discontinued mobile device launched in February 2006 featuring GSM technology with support for bands at 900/1800/1900 MHz and Class 10 GPRS connectivity. It has dimensions of 101 x 48 x 13.6 mm, weighing approximately 95 grams (3.35 oz), equipped with a mini-SIM card for network accessibility. The device boasts an external mono OLED display measuring 176x220 pixels and offering video recording capabilities alongside its single main camera of 1.3 MP resolution, which can capture still images as well. With internal storage capacity to hold up to 54MB including a phonebook with space for 500 entries, the NEC N500iS also supports various forms of communication such as SMS, EMS, and MMS along with email services through its WAP(Nec e959) browser. Additionally, it offers Java capabilities (MIDP 2.0), MP3/AAC/MP4 playback options, predictive text input, organizer functions, voice memo recording, and SyncML synchronization for the calendar or contacts management. The device is powered by a removable Li-Ion battery with an energy capacity of 820mAh that can last up to 3 hours in talk time mode under standby conditions. Notably, it lacks WLAN connectivity and Bluetooth but does have USB support for proprietary devices; its body is available only in black color.

The Tel.Me T910 is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting both 900 and 1800 MHz bands as of its specification details from 2002 when it was announced but has since been discontinued. It features a compact body, measuring 109 x 45 x 18 mm (4.29 x 1.77 x 0.71 inches) and weighs approximately 80 grams (2.82 ounces). The device comes with a Mini-SIM card slot, allowing for up to 10 dialed calls, received calls, and missed call notifications within contact groups in the phonebook feature set. Despite its discontinuation status, it boasts basic communication features such as SMS messaging capability along with WAP 1.1 browser support that includes predictive text input, organizer functions like a calendar or world clock, voice dialing, and even recording capabilities for memos using the built-in loudspeaker which also plays monophonic ringtones upon selection from downloads. The phone's battery is equipped with a removable Li-Ion 600 mAh capacity that can sustain up to two hours of talk time or around 200 hours in standby mode, providing reasonable usage duration for its size and technology era. However, it lacks advanced features such as WLAN connectivity, Bluetooth pairing capability, a camera module, audio output through speakers, alerts beyond ringtones, positional services like GPS or radio communication, USB connection options, video recording capabilities (as there's no mention of display resolution in terms of pixels for videos), and additional RAM. The device also does not have an expansion card slot but includes a basic clock function with alarm settings as well as Java support.

The Toshiba Excite 7.7 AT275 is a smartphone with Android OS version 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) powered by Nvidia's Tegra 3 chipset and features a quad-core CPU running at 1.5 GHz, complemented by an ULP GeForce GPU for enhanced graphics performance. It boasts a vibrant AMOLED display with dimensions of 7.7 inches in size and resolution details of 1280x80 extraneous pixels set on a ~62.2% screen-to-body ratio, offering clear visuals to the user. The device supports various network technologies including GSM/HSPA (bands: 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900), HSDPA for high-speed data access and also has compatibility with GPRS, EDGE networks. With dimensions of approximately 204.5 x 135.2 mm by 7.8 mm (or about 8.05 x 5.32 x 0.31 inches) and a weight of around 332 grams or 11.71 ounces, it's designed with portability in mind. The phone includes microSDHC card slot for expandable storage options along with internal configurations ranging from 16GB RAM to upwards of 64GB RAM and comes equipped with a dual-camera system featuring both a single rear camera (5MP AF, video recording at 720p) and a selfie camera (2 MP). Connectivity is robust as it includes Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n capabilities along with Bluetooth 3.0 for wireless peripheral connections; however, the device lacks GPS or radio modules but does have miniUSB 2.0 and a stereo speaker setup through its headphone jack. The phone is constructed in dark gray metallic color schemes and was priced around 410 EUR when it launched in April of 2012, with the device being discontinued later that year after release in July. It also includes a range of sensors like an accelerometer, gyro, and compass for various applications.

The Wiko T3 smartphone supports a variety of network technologies including GSM/HSPA/LTE with dual-SIM capabilities across multiple bands (GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900) and HSDPA for its 3G connectivity. It was launched in December of 2021, making it a relatively recent addition to the market with Android 11 as its operating system on top of Mediatek MT6765 Helio P35 chipset paired with an octa-core CPU and PowerVR GE8320 GPU for efficient performance. The device boasts substantial internal storage capacity, offering up to 128GB coupled with a hefty 4GB of RAM via microSDXC card slot expansion. Its main camera system is robust featuring a triple setup—a primary 48MP sensor complemented by two additional sensors for AF and macro shots, all capable of recording in high definition at 1080p@30fps with HDR support and panorama functionality. The selfie camera module offers an 8MP resolution to capture quality close-up images or videos. Powering the device is a non-removable Li-Ion battery rated for up to 5000mAh, ensuring extended usage between charges. Available in black and gold color options, it also includes various sensors like fingerprint (side-mounted), accelerometer, and proximity alongside standard communication features such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth with A2DP and LE capabilities, FM radio, NFC for contactless transactions, a 3.5mm audio jack, GPS, GLONASS, Galileo positioning systems, but notably lacks an NFC feature. The device dimensions are approximately 165.3 x 76 x 9.2 mm with a weight of around 188 grams and comes equipped with either a single or dual-SIM card slot for flexible connectivity options.

The INNO 50 by Innostream features GSM technology with support for both 900 and 1800 MHz bands as its primary network standard but does not have EDGE capability. Launched in Q1 of 2004, it has since been discontinued. The device measures approximately 88.6 mm in length, 44.5 mm in width, and 22.5 mm in height with a weight of about 90 grams (3.17 oz). It comes equipped with a TFT display capable of showing up to 256K colors but does not specify the screen size or resolution beyond stating it has an external second display that can swivel, which records video and offers downloadable logos in approximately 96x96 pixels. The phone includes one main camera sensor rated at 1.3 MP with LED flash capabilities for photography and also supports basic audio functions through stereo speakers along with vibration alerts and the ability to play customizable polyphonic ringtones via a 3.5mm jack, though it lacks an infrared port or WLAN connectivity options like Bluetooth or USB. It has sufficient internal memory for storing up to 250 phone contacts and can handle about two hours of talk time on a single charge from its removable Li-Ion battery with approximately 100 hours of standby usage, lasting around three hours when in use. The INNO 50 is available in silver color options only as per the listed specifications.

The Sewon SRD-200 is a mobile device featuring GSM technology with support for both 900 and 1800 MHz bands but lacks EDGE capability. It was announced in Q2 of 2004 before being discontinued later on. The phone has dimensions of 87.5 x 47.5 x 21.7 mm with a weight of approximately 95 grams and utilizes a mini-SIM card for connectivity. It boasts an STN display capable of showing up to 65,000 colors in a resolution of 128x128 pixels on a 1:1 aspect ratio screen with the ability to download external logos and wallpapers as its second display feature. The device comes equipped with a single VGA camera for still images but does not support video capture, along with an internal memory capacity that can hold up to 500 phonebook contacts or store records of 10 dialed calls, received calls, and missed calls each. Despite having no built-in WLAN, Bluetooth, positioning services like GPS, radio communication capabilities, USB connectivity, nor a card slot for memory expansion, the Sewon SRD-200 does offer an internal removable Li-Ion 900 mAh battery and includes basic features such as SMS/EMS messaging. It operates on Android with WAP version 1.2.1 browser support is available along with Java for some applications, but it lacks a selfie camera or external loudspeaker feature.

The Karbonn Titanium Hexa features a robust Android platform with an OS version of Android 4.4.2 (KitKat) and Mediatek MT6591 chipset at its core, powered by a hexa-core CPU operating at 1.5 GHz Cortex-A7 frequency along with the Mali-450MP4 GPU for efficient processing tasks. It boasts an impressive display of IPS LCD type measuring 5.5 inches in size and offering high resolution, specifically a sharpness defined by its 1080x1920 pixel count on a nearly square (~70.5% screen-to-body ratio). The device supports dual SIM technology with dimensions of approximately 154 x 76.8 mm and weighs around 6.06 inches, although the exact weight is not specified in the data provided. In terms of connectivity options, it includes GSM/HSPA capabilities across multiple bands (GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900) and HSDPA for enhanced mobile broadband access with speeds up to 42.2/5.76 Mbps, as well as GPRS and EDGE services. The smartphone also includes a main camera of 13 MP AF capable of panoramic shots thanks to its LED flash feature along with standard single-camera selfie capabilities at 5MP resolution for casual photography needs. Additionally, the device is equipped with Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity (4.0 A2DP), a microUSB 2.0 port supporting OTG functions alongside WLAN compatibility but lacks NFC or GPS positioning technology; it also has an accelerometer and proximity sensor for motion detection, all housed within its Li-Po battery of approximately 2050mAh capacity that offers substantial usage time before requiring a recharge.

The Telit T420 is a discontinued mobile device launched in Q1 of 2005 with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800 MHz and Class 8 GPRS capability. It has dimensions of 62 x 64 x 23 mm (2.44 x 2.52 x 0.91 inches) and weighs approximately 82 grams (2.89 ounces). The device features a TFT display with up to 65,000 colors that measures 128x160 pixels in size but does not specify the resolution for its second OLED screen which can play videos and download animations. It comes equipped with a single VGA camera capable of video recording. The device supports basic messaging services like SMS, EMS, and MMS along with Java-based applications such as a photo editor, video player, and predictive text input organizer. Powered by a removable Li-Ion 650 mAh battery, the Telit T420 offers up to 100 hours of standby time and approximately two hours of talk time per charge. The device is available in black color only with no additional card slot or built-in memory for phonebooks beyond a limit of 300 entries; it also lacks features like WLAN, Bluetooth connectivity, USB port, Sensor technology, positioning services, radio communication, and has an alert system that vibrates while supporting downloadable polyphonic ringtones.

The Fairphone 4 boasts a robust design with dimensions of 162 x 75.5 x 10.5 mm and weighs approximately 225 grams (7.94 oz). It features an IP54 rating for dust and splash resistance, along with compliance to MIL-STANDARD 810G testing protocols which ensures durability against harsh conditions. The device is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 750G 5G chipset (Snapdragon 2x2.2 GHz Kryo 570 & 6x1.8 GHz Kryo 570) and an Adreno 619 GPU, offering a powerful performance for mobile tasks with its octa-core CPU setup. The Fairphone 4 is equipped with dual cameras on the rear—one main sensor of 48 MP (f/1.6, ultrawide angle at 1/2.0", and another TOF depth sensor—alongside a single 25 MP front camera for selfies or video calls in HDR quality up to 1080p@30 fps. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi (802.11a/b/g/n/ac, dual band), Bluetooth 5.1 with A2DP and LE capabilities, NFC for close proximity exchanges of data or payments, GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, BDS positioning systems—and it supports USB Type-C connectivity (OTG & DisplayPort). The device comes in gray, green, and speckled green colors with a 3905 mAh Li-Ion battery that can be charged at up to 20W wired or reach about half capacity within 30 minutes. It also offers expandable storage via microSDXC card slot and has an internal configuration of either 128GB/6GB RAM, with options for more memory configurations available upon request.

The Bird D706 is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting both 900 and 1800 MHz bands along with Class 12 GPRS capabilities but lacks EDGE connectivity. Announced in 2007, it has since been cancelled for production or sale. The device boasts dimensions of 105 x 45.6 mm by 12.2 mm and weighs approximately 84 grams (2.96 oz). It features a TFT display capable of showing up to 23.7% screen-to-body ratio with resolution details at 176x220 pixels, sourced from an internal Li-Ion battery that offers standby time for up to 120 hours and talk time lasting around 3 hours and 20 minutes on a single charge. The phone includes microSD card support, can store approximately 60MB of data internally, and has the capacity for SMS, EMS, MMS messaging along with Java-based applications such as games (MIDP 2.0) and multimedia playback including MP3 player and MP4 video recorder functionalities. Despite its rich feature set that includes a single main camera of 1.3MP resolution capable for both still images and videos, the Bird D706 does not have built-in WiFi or Bluetooth connectivity options nor positioning services like GPS but comes with an internal speaker and vibration alert system along with MP3 ringtones support via a proprietary audio jack setup.

The Wiko T50 smartphone supports multiple network technologies including GSM/HSPA and LTE with dual SIM capabilities (Nano-SIM) across various bands from W-P861-01 to W-P861-02. Launched in May 2022, the Wiko T50 is equipped with an Android 11 operating system and powered by Mediatek MT6769Z Helio G85 chipset featuring a dual octa-core CPU setup (Cortex-A75 & Cortex-A55) clocking at up to 2.0 GHz, complemented by the Mali-G52 MC2 GPU for graphics processing. The device boasts an IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080x2400 pixels and covers approximately 89.3% screen-to-body ratio on its 6.6 inches diagonal, offering sharp visuals in either black or available colors like Black, Green, Pink. It has an internal memory configuration that can be configured with up to 128GB of storage paired with between 4 and 6GB of RAM depending on the model variant (W-P861-01/02). The main camera system is a triple setup consisting of a 64MP primary sensor, an 8MP secondary lens, and a 2MP depth sensor capable of HDR video recording at 1080p@30fps. Additionally, the Wiko T50 includes features like Wi-Fi with dual bands (802.11a/b/g/n/ac), Bluetooth 5.1 A2DP LE for audio streaming and a fingerprint sensor alongside an accelerometer and compass as part of its array of sensors, all housed within the dimensions of approximately 160.7 x 73.3 mm with a weight of around 179 grams (6.31 oz). The device also has dual SIM slots for flexibility in connectivity and comes with a Li-Ion battery rated at 4000mAh, which can be charged up to 40W wiredly.

The Tecno Pova Neo 3 is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA and LTE technology supporting multiple bands including both SIM1 & SIM2 for enhanced connectivity options across various networks such as 850, 900, 1800, and 1900 MHz. Launched in June 2023 with availability starting from July of the same year, this Android-based device is powered by Mediatek's Helio G85 chipset clocked at an octa-core configuration featuring Cortex-A75 and Cortex-A55 processors. It boasts a high resolution IPS LCD display with 90Hz refresh rate, measuring up to 6.82 inches in size and offering approximately 83.4% screen-to-body ratio for an immersive visual experience at 720x1640 pixels clarity. The device is equipped with a dual rear camera system on the single lens, featuring a primary sensor of 16 MP (wide) and an auxiliary AF/NFC sensor of 0.08 MP for diverse photography capabilities including HDR and panorama functions at up to 1080p@30fps video recording quality. With internal storage options ranging from 4GB to 8GB RAM, paired with a non-removable microSDXC card slot, the Tecno Pova Neo 3 provides ample memory for extensive applications and media usage. Additionally, it includes essential communication features like Wi-Fi 802.11a/b/g/n/ac dual bands along with Bluetooth connectivity, a FM radio, NFC support, GPS, GLONASS, and BDS positioning systems to facilitate various location services while offering an impressive LiPo battery of up to 7000mAh for extended usage. Available in Amber Gold, Mecha Black, or Hurricane Blue colors under the LH6n model lineup, it comes with a glass front and plastic frame body construction that supports dual SIM (Nano-SIM) operation. The device also has an integrated loudspeaker and 3.5mm headphone jack for audio output needs.

The i-mobile TV650 Touch is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800/1900 MHz and Class 10 GPRS connectivity for data transmission. It was announced in July of 2009, during the fourth quarter, but has since been discontinued. The device boasts a TFT display with 256K colors that measures 3.0 inches across, offering approximately 46.1% screen-to-body ratio and displays content at resolutions of 240x320 pixels in a 4:3 aspect ratio. It has an integrated single main camera module capable of capturing images with up to 3.15 MP quality and can record videos, although it does not have a selfie camera feature. The phone comes equipped with accelerometer sensors for motion detection along with basic messaging capabilities including SMS threaded view, EMS (Emergency Messaging System), MMS support, as well as WAP 2.0/xHTML browser functionality and Java compatibility for mobile games. Powering the device is a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 1000mAh with up to 200 hours of standby time or approximately two hours and thirty minutes of talk time, operating on miniUSB connectivity. The phone also features Bluetooth technology (Class 1.2 A2DP), FM radio reception, but lacks WLAN capability; it does not have a microSDHC card slot for additional storage despite having space in the memory to store up to 1000 contacts and photos with photocall functionality.

The Cubot KingKong 8 is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE technology and dual Nano-SIM compatibility for enhanced connectivity options across various networks including multiple bands from 2G to 4G. Launched in October 2023, this Android device boasts an octa-core Mediatek MT8788V chipset with a combination of Cortex-A73 and Cortex-A53 processors for efficient performance. It has a large IPS LCD display measuring approximately 6.53 inches in size, offering high resolution at 720x1612 pixels to deliver sharp visuals. The phone comes with substantial internal storage of up to 256GB and RAM capacity of 12GB for ample data handling capabilities. Its camera system includes a powerful triple rear setup (48MP main, 2MP wide-angle, and 0.3MP macro) along with LED flash support, while the front is equipped with a single 16MP selfie shooter capable of recording in up to 1080p video quality. The device also includes various communication features such as Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n/ac and Bluetooth 4.2 A2DP, NFC for close proximity data transfer, GPS with GLONASS and Galileo positioning systems, and it has a Li-Ion battery of up to 10600mAh capacity that supports wired charging options. Available in black, red, or green colors at €189.99/US$119.99, the Cubot KingKong 8 is built with durability and water resistance (up to IP68 standards), capable of surviving submersion underwater for up to 30 minutes and resisting drops from concrete surfaces.

The BQ Aquaris U2 is a modern smartphone featuring Android OS (7.1.2 Nougat), with an upgrade option to Android 8.0 Oreo and powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 435 chipset, offering robust performance for mobile tasks. It boasts dual-SIM capabilities including nano-SIM slots supporting GSM bands (850/900/1800) as well as HSDPA on multiple frequency bands and LTE across various frequencies such as 7, 8, 20, and 28. The device has a large IPS LCD display with a size of 5.2 inches and resolutions at 720x1280 pixels in a 16:9 aspect ratio, protected by Dinorex glass for durability against scratches or impacts. With dimensions measuring approximately 148.1 x 72.9 x 8.4 mm and weighing around 155 grams (or about 5.47 oz), it offers a comfortable size with easy handling in hand for everyday use on the go. The phone's main camera is equipped with a single, high-quality sensor of 13MP capable of capturing HDR and panorama photos or recording videos at up to 1080p@30fps while its selfie camera offers decent quality for personal moments in full HD. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n/ac, dual band), Bluetooth 4.2 with A2DP and LE support along with aptX audio codec enhancement, NFC technology, FM radio reception, GPS, GLONASS, BDS, and Galileo positioning systems for precise location tracking; it also has a microUSB port for charging or data transfer at up to 18W wired charge rate. The device is available in black color with internal storage of 16GB paired with either 2GB or expandable via microSDXC, and comes equipped with an Adreno 505 GPU along with a dual-core Cortex-A53 CPU operating at up to 1.4 GHz for efficient multitasking between applications. Priced around 190 EUR, the BQ Aquaris U2 provides essential smartphone features in its category within an affordable range and was released available since September following a notable announcement in 2017 with October availability date.

The Google Pixel 6 Pro boasts a large LTPO AMOLED display with a resolution of 1440x3120 pixels and a refresh rate of up to 120Hz, protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus. It operates on Android 12, upgradable to Android 14, powered by Google Tensor chipset with an octa-core CPU comprising two high performance cores (Cortex-X1) and four efficiency cores (Cortex-A55). The device supports a wide array of network technologies including GSM, CDMA, HSPA, LTE, as well as 5G across multiple bands. It features an always-on display with dual Nano-SIM and eSIM capabilities for flexible connectivity options. With three main cameras—a primary 50 MP wide camera, a 48 MP telephoto lens capable of optical zoom up to 4x, and a versatile 12 MP ultrawide angle sensor — the Pixel 6 Pro is well-equipped for photography with Auto-HDR and panorama features. The device also offers stereo speakers without a traditional headphone jack but includes Wi-Fi 802.11b/g/n/ac/6e, dual-band Wi-Fi Direct, Bluetooth 5.2 with A2DP and LE for audio connectivity, as well as NFC support alongside GPS, GLONASS, BDS (Galileo), QZSS positioning systems. Weighing in at approximately 210 grams within its aluminum frame encased by Gorilla Glass Victus on both front and back, the Pixel 6 Pro is a modern smartphone with various internal configurations of storage options ranging from 128GB to 512GB paired with up to 12GB RAM.

The Blackview Oscal Spider 8 is a versatile smartphone with GSM/HSPA/LTE technology supporting multiple bands including dual Nano-SIM slots and offering high speed HSDPA connectivity up to LTE. Launched in August 2023, it boasts dimensions of 251.3 x 170.1 x 14.9 mm with a weight of approximately 854 grams. The device runs on Android Doke OS_P version 3.0 and is powered by the Unisoc Tiger T616 chipset, featuring an octa-core CPU (2x2.0 GHz Cortex-A75 & 6x1.8 GHz Cortex-A55) alongside a Mali-G57 MP1 GPU for efficient processing and graphics rendering. It has a large internal memory of 128GB storage with an additional microSDXC card slot, complemented by 8GB RAM to handle multitasking smoothly. The phone is equipped with dual rear cameras (one being 13MP) featuring LED flash for enhanced photography and can record videos at 1080p resolution up to 30fps on the primary camera, while offering a single 16MP selfie shooter option. With Wi-Fi 802.11a/b/g/n/ac dual bands, Bluetooth 5.0 with A2DP, and FM Radio capabilities along with USB Type-C OTG support for connectivity options, the Blackview Oscal Spider 8 also has a robust IP68/IP69K dust and water resistance up to 1.5 meters depth or immersion time of 30 minutes as per MIL-STD-810H standards. Additionally, it includes various sensors like an accelerometer, gyro, proximity sensor, and compass for motion detection and orientation purposes. The device comes with a Li-Ion battery rated at 13000mAh capacity, supporting fast wired charging up to 33W as well as reverse wireless charging capabilities of 5W through the microSD card slot. Available in black or orange colors and priced around 220 EUR, it's a powerful device for network connectivity with substantial onboard memory and camera specifications suitable for photography enthusiasts.

The Ultimate 9150 by i-mate features a GSM/HSPA technology with support for multiple bands including GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 and HSDPA on 850 / 1900 / 2100 frequencies. Announced in February 2007, the device unfortunately has a cancelled status but was equipped with an Intel Bulverde CPU running at 520 MHz within its Microsoft Windows Mobile 6.0 Professional operating system environment. It boasts dimensions of 98 x 50 x 19 mm and weighs approximately 3.86 inches, featuring a mini-SIM for connectivity needs. The device includes a TFT resistive touchscreen display with 256K colors (effectively displaying around 42.7% screen-to-body ratio) that measures 2.6 inches diagonally and supports video recording capabilities along with handwriting recognition features. It has an internal memory setup of 128MB RAM, expandable via a microSD card slot up to certain limits not specified in the data provided. The device also includes a single-camera module capable of capturing photos at 2MP resolution and can record video; additionally, it offers various audio functionalities such as MP3 ringtones with vibration alerts for notifications. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/e/i), Bluetooth 2.0 A2DP, a stereo FM radio and miniUSB port along with an infrared transmitter capability. The Ultimate 9150 is powered by a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 1400mAh for extended use between charges.

The Smartwatch 2ES by itel features an IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1.8 inches and approximately 240 x 286 pixels (~207 ppi density), offering clear visuals for its users. Despite lacking cellular connectivity options such as GPRS, EDGE, or various bands including 2G, 3G, and 4G, it does support Bluetooth technology with capabilities like A2DP and LE through a Li-Ion battery rated at 250mAh. The device is constructed from plastic materials for its back and frame but includes an IP68 rating indicating dust and water resistance up to certain depths. It comes equipped with sensors such as accelerometer, heart rate monitor, and SpO2 sensor without a built-in camera or 3.5mm audio jack. The Smartwatch 2ES operates on its proprietary operating system and has no card slot for expansion but does have unspecified internal storage capacity to manage user data. Available since the announcement in 2023, it is currently accessible for purchase with a sleek black color option available among others. Notably absent are WLAN or NFC capabilities, as well as any form of removable memory expansion.

The Soul X7 Style by Allview is a modern smartphone featuring Android 9.0 (Pie) OS and powered by Mediatek MT6763 Helio P23 chipset with an octa-core CPU comprising of four Cortex-A53 cores running at 2.0 GHz, alongside another four Cortex-A53 cores operating at 1.5 GHz. It boasts a large IPS LCD display measuring 6.21 inches diagonally with a resolution of 720x1520 pixels and maintains approximately an 81.2% screen-to-body ratio, offering vibrant visual experiences for users on the go. The device supports various network technologies including GSM/EDGE (bands: 850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz), HSPA+ with speeds up to HSDPA and LTE across multiple bands for fast data connectivity. The phone is equipped with a dual-camera system on the rear featuring a primary sensor of 13 MP (f/2.2) with an additional depth sensor, both capable of recording videos in 1080p at 30 frames per second and includes LED flash for better low light photography along with HDR capabilities; meanwhile, it has a single 5MP selfie camera on the front. With dual Nano-SIM compatibility (standby) and weighing around 6.53 oz, this device offers versatile connectivity options through Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n standards, Bluetooth 4.0 with A2DP for audio streaming, GPS, GLONASS positioning systems but lacks NFC and FM radio capabilities; it also has a LiPo battery of 3400mAh capacity ensuring extended usage between charges. Available since its release in May 2020, the Soul X7 Style comes with internal storage options up to 64GB and RAM memory size at 4GB, priced approximately around 130 EUR.

The Wiko Hi Enjoy 60s is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE/5G technology supporting bands from 850 to 1900 MHz with dual SIM capabilities via Nano-SIM. Launched in November of 2023, this device runs on HarmonyOS and is powered by Mediatek's Dimensity 700 chipset featuring an octa-core CPU clocked at up to 2.2 GHz with Cortex-A76 & A55 cores for efficient performance alongside Mali-G57 MC2 GPU hardware acceleration, ensuring smooth multitasking and gaming experiences on its TFT LCD display of 6.75 inches in size boasting a resolution of 720x1600 pixels with an aspect ratio close to the human eye's natural field of view at approximately 260 ppi density. It offers dual rear cameras, each offering 13 MP wide and depth shots respectively, complemented by a single 8 MP front camera for selfies or low-light photography in good quality up to 1080p@30fps video recording. The device supports Wi-Fi standards including the latest ac standard along with Bluetooth 5.1 A2DP and LE connectivity, while also having GPS capabilities through GLONASS, BDS, QZSS positioning systems without NFC but includes a microSDXC card slot for expandable storage up to 256GB internal memory capacity. Weighing in at around 7.02 oz and measuring approximately 168.3 x 77.7 mm with dimensions of 9mm, it's powered by a non-removable Li-Po battery rated for up to 6000mAh capacity that can be charged at an output rate of 22.5W via wired connection and comes in black, blue, or white color options with an estimated price point around 200 EUR. The device is equipped with a variety of sensors including fingerprint recognition (side-mounted), accelerometer, proximity sensor, and compass for enhanced user interaction alongside basic audio features like a loudspeaker and a standard 3.5mm headphone jack.

The Ericsson T20s is a discontinued mobile device launched around the year 2000 with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800 MHz and no additional features like GPRS or EDGE connectivity. It has dimensions of approximately 101 x 54 x 28 mm (3.98 x 2.13 x 1.10 inches) with a weight of about 128 grams (4.52 oz). The device comes equipped with a monochrome graphic display and offers resolution capabilities down to 101x33 pixels across 3 characters in size, although the exact screen dimensions are not specified within this data set. It includes basic messaging features such as SMS support but lacks advanced functionalities like WLAN or Bluetooth connectivity options. The Ericsson T20s is powered by a removable NiMH battery with 1300mAh capacity, providing up to 200 hours of standby time and approximately 10 hours of talk time per charge. Design-wise, it comes in four colors: Blue Whirl, Lime Twist, Silver Weave, and Beige Harmony.

The Sagem my721z is a discontinued mobile device with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800/1900 MHz and includes GPRS capability but lacks EDGE. It was announced in February of 2008 and has since been released that same year. The phone measures approximately 106 x 52 x 12 mm with a weight of about 125 grams, featuring a mini-SIM card slot for memory expansion via microSD cards up to dedicated slots. It boasts a TFT display capable of showing around 27.6% screen-to-body ratio and offers resolutions at approximately 176x220 pixels with support for about 128 ppi density, including mirror effects on the screen. The device includes one main camera sensor rated at 3.15 MP capable of video recording but does not have a selfie camera feature. Sound is provided through a loudspeaker and vibration alerts are supported along with polyphonic ringtones; however, it lacks both WLAN connectivity and Bluetooth technology. The phone comes equipped with Java for mobile applications (MIDP 2.0) and can play music while offering SMS, MMS, Instant Messaging services as part of its messaging suite along with a basic browser using WAP 2.0/xHTML standards. It has an internal Li-Ion removable battery that supports up to two hours of standby time or three hours of talk time and comes in silver color options.

The Era X smartphone by GSM/HSPA/LTE technology supports dual SIM operation and offers connectivity across various networks including GSM (900 / 1800 MHz), HSDPA for enhanced mobile broadband access at speeds up to 21.1/5.76 Mbps, as well as LTE Cat4 with download rates of up to 150/50 Mbps on bands 3, 5, and 40. Launched in February 2016, the Era X has since been discontinued but was notable for its robust feature set at that time. It boasts a high-resolution IPS LCD display with dimensions of approximately 5 inches diagonally (68.9 cm² screen area) and resolutions up to 720x1280 pixels, adhering closely to the standard aspect ratio for modern screens at about 294 ppi density. The device is powered by an Android operating system with version 5.1.1 Lollipop available as a base OS and can be upgraded up to Android 6.0 Marshmallow, running on a Spreadtrum SC9830A chipset alongside a quad-core CPU clocked at 1.5 GHz for efficient processing tasks. With internal memory of 8GB RAM complemented by an additional microSDHC card slot and external storage capacity up to 2GB RAM, the Era X is designed for multitasking with ease. The smartphone includes a primary rear-facing camera module rated at 8MP AF (autofocus) featuring LED flash and panorama capabilities along with HDR video recording in 1080p@30fps quality, while the front-facing selfie camera is simpler at 5 MP. It also has a built-in loudspeaker for audio output and supports connectivity options such as Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.0 with A2DP, FM radio reception via the device's microUSB port, but lacks NFC technology; it also comes in a sleek black color scheme and is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass on its display for durability against impacts. The Era X smartphone includes sensors like an accelerometer and proximity sensor to enhance user interaction with the device's features, such as auto-rotation of the screen based on orientation or detection when it’s near a head during calls. It is powered by a removable LiPo battery rated at 2500mAh for extended use between charges and comes equipped with GPS functionality through its WLAN/Bluetooth connectivity options, although NFC remains unavailable on this model. The phone's dimensions are listed as approximately 145.5 x 72 x 8.5 mm (0.563 x 2.83 x 0.33 inches).

The Karbonn Titanium Octane is an Android smartphone featuring a vibrant IPS LCD display measuring 5.0 inches with a resolution of 720x1280 pixels and approximately a 66.4% screen-to-body ratio, offering sharp visuals for media consumption or gaming on the go. It operates on Android 4.4.2 (KitKat) platform using Mediatek MT6592 chipset with an octa-core CPU running at a speed of up to 1.7 GHz and powered by Mali-450MP4 GPU for efficient graphics processing. The device supports dual SIM technology, allowing users flexibility in connectivity options including compatibility with multiple network bands such as GSM (850/900/1800/1900), HSPA at 42.2/5.76 Mbps speed and also has support for EDGE and basic GPRS services, although it does not include LTE capabilities or NFC technology. The smartphone comes with a substantial internal memory of 16GB storage paired with 1GB RAM facilitated by microSDHC card expansion options up to an additional 128GB via the included slot. For photography and videography, it is equipped with a single rear-facing camera module offering 13 MP resolution along with AF capabilities as well as LED flash for low light conditions; however, there's no front-facing selfie camera mentioned in its specifications. The device also includes standard features like an accelerometer, gyro, proximity sensor, and compass within the sensors category to enhance user experience through motion detection and location tracking. Lastly, it is powered by a removable Li-Ion 2000 mAh battery with wireless connectivity options such as Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n) and Bluetooth 4.0 A2DP for audio streaming via the built-in loudspeaker, which is complemented by a standard 3.5mm jack input. The phone was announced in March of 2014 but has since been discontinued as per its launch details.

The Xiaomi 13T Pro boasts a high-resolution AMOLED display with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection and supports HDR10+ for vivid visuals; it measures approximately 6.67 inches diagonally across its screen, which has a resolution of 1220 x 2712 pixels on a 20:9 aspect ratio. The device operates on Android 13 with MIUI 14 and is powered by Mediatek's Dimensity 9200+ chipset, featuring an octa-core CPU setup including Cortex-X3 at 3.35 GHz for high performance tasks alongside a GPU from Immortalis-G715 MC11 series. It offers multiple memory configurations with options of up to 16GB RAM and comes in internal storage capacities ranging from 256GB, paired with either 12 or higher amounts of RAM depending on the model selected. The phone's camera system is robust, featuring a triple-camera setup including a primary 50 MP wide lens sensor for detailed photos and videos at various frame rates up to 8K per second in slow motion; it also has an additional telephoto mode with optical zoom capabilities along with a secondary ultrawide angle of 12MP. Connectivity options are extensive, offering Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n/ac and Bluetooth 5.4 A2DP LE alongside GPS (L1+L5), GLONASS, Galileo, NavIC for precise positioning; it also includes NFC technology but lacks an infrared port or built-in radio module. The Xiaomi 13T Pro is equipped with a Li-Po battery of up to 5000mAh capacity and can be charged at speeds reaching 120W wired, promising full charge in as little as 19 minutes according to the manufacturer's specifications. Available colors include Alpine Blue, Meadow Green, and Black with models identified by PND5G codes; it is priced starting from €687.12 or $650.

The Bosch 909 Dual is a discontinued mobile device launched in 1999 with GSM technology supporting bands at 900/1800 MHz and no support for GPRS or EDGE. It has dimensions of 112 x 50 x 17 mm (4.41 x 1.97 x 0.67 inches) with a weight of approximately 3.49 ounces, featuring a monochrome graphic display that can show up to 4x16 characters and dynamically adjust its font size along with soft keys for ease of use. The device comes equipped with an integrated PCMCIA card slot capable of holding up to 100 phonebook entries and logs dialed, received, and missed calls—each limited to a count of ten per category. Despite having no camera or loudspeaker features, the Bosch 909 Dual includes SMS messaging capability for communication needs but lacks WLAN connectivity options like Bluetooth, GPS positioning, radio services, USB connection, and integrated video recording functions due to its non-existent built-in camera. It operates on a removable Li-Ion 650 mAh battery with up to 70 hours of standby time and can last for about three hours in talk time mode. Available in three different colors, the device also includes basic features like an alarm clock, calculator functions, but does not support games or Java applications on its platform.

The Amoi E72 is a mobile phone with GSM technology supporting both 900 and 1900 MHz bands, offering HSPA speed for faster internet access along with basic GPRS capabilities but lacking EDGE. Launched in 2007, this device has since been discontinued. It boasts a TFT display that is capable of showing up to 65K colors and measures approximately 2 inches diagonally across its screen, which covers roughly 28.1% of the phone's body surface area with a resolution of 176x220 pixels at about 141 ppi density. The device runs on Microsoft Windows Mobile 5.0 Phone Edition and comes equipped with a microSD card slot for additional storage, housing an internal memory capacity of up to 64MB. It features a single main camera sensor rated at 1.3 megapixels capable of taking photos and recording video. Despite its age, the Amoi E72 includes vibration-based alerts and supports downloadable polyphonic ringtones but lacks modern connectivity options such as WLAN or Bluetooth; it also does not have a 3.5mm audio jack for wired headsets nor built-in speakers. The phone is powered by a removable Li-Ion battery with an energy capacity of 1100mAh, and its dimensions are listed as approximately 100 x 44.8 x 14.8 mm (3.94 x 1.76 x 0.58 inches). It comes in a black color scheme.

The Xiaomi Redmi Note 13 Pro+ features a high-resolution OLED display with dimensions of 6.67 inches and a resolution of 1220 x 2712 pixels, offering an immersive viewing experience in Dolby Vision HDR10+ format at up to 1800 nits brightness for clear visuals even under direct sunlight. It operates on Android 13 with the MIUI 14 interface and is powered by a Dimensity 7200 Ultra chipset, providing robust performance backed by an octa-core CPU (2x2.8 GHz Cortex-A715 & 6x2.0 GHz Cortex-A510) alongside Mali-G610 MC4 GPU for smooth multitasking and gaming experiences. The device supports dual SIM capabilities with Nano-SIM slots, ensuring flexibility in connectivity options including support for various 4G bands (8, 19, 34, 38, 39, 40, 41) as well as a wide array of 5G bands. With an impressive main camera setup featuring a primary 200 MP sensor with multi-directional PDAF and OIS alongside two additional sensors for macro shots or ultrawide angles, it excels in photography capabilities including HDR support and can record videos at up to 4K resolution. The device is equipped with LiPo battery technology of approximately 5000 mAh capacity that supports fast charging speeds reaching a full charge within about 19 minutes using wired PD3.0, ensuring long-lasting usage on the go. Available in black, white, violet, and camo green colors with RAM options of either 12 or 16GB, it's priced around 250 EUR as of its release date in September 2023.

The Lenovo Tab M8 (4th Gen) features a robust Android 13 operating system built on Mediatek Helio A22 chipset with an octa-core CPU comprising of four Cortex-A53 and four Cortex-A53 cores running at up to 2.3 GHz, paired with PowerVR GPU for efficient graphics processing. It boasts a high resolution IPS LCD display measuring 8.0 inches with an aspect ratio of approximately 16:10 pixels, offering sharp visuals through its 800x1280 pixel screen and delivering up to 350 nits brightness for clear visibility in various light conditions. The device supports a wide range of network technologies including GSM/EDGE (bands at 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 MHz), HSPA, and LTE across multiple bands from 1 to 26 with speeds up to HSPA. With dimensions of 197.8 x 119.8 x 9 mm and a weight of around 320 grams, it's designed for portability without compromising on screen real estate or build quality; the device has glass front and plastic components with Nano-SIM compatibility. Storage options include up to 64GB RAM paired with either 32GB internal storage using an eMMC 5.1, while it comes equipped with a dual rear camera system—a primary single 8MP AF/8MP AF and secondary 2 MP selfie camera for versatile photography at resolutions of up to 1080p video quality. Connectivity options are comprehensive: Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac with dual bands, Bluetooth 5.0 supporting A2DP and LE protocols, GPS along with GLONASS and BDS positioning systems for accurate location services—though it lacks NFC capabilities; the device also includes an FM radio but does not have a built-in cellular data connection or USB Type-C OTG support. Priced around 150 EUR, its battery life is powered by a non-removable LiPo 5100 mAh unit with fast wired charging capabilities of up to 10W for quick energy replenishment when needed. Available since April and released in May this year, it comes available now at various retailers or directly from Lenovo.

The Gionee S12 Lite is a smartphone with Android 10 operating system built on Mediatek MT6762D Helio A25 chipset and an octa-core CPU consisting of four Cortex-A53 cores running at up to 1.8GHz, complemented by PowerVR GE8320 GPU for efficient graphics processing. It boasts a large internal storage capacity with 32GB and comes equipped with 3GB RAM along with an additional microSDXC card slot expansion option. The device features three main cameras—13MP wide, 5MP ultrawide, and 2MP depth sensor for improved photography capabilities including HDR support and LED flash technology. With a Li-Po battery of up to 4000mAh capacity (non-removable), the phone offers substantial usage time between charges. Available in blue, green, or gray colors, it measures approximately 166.2 x 76.3 x 8.4 mm and weighs around 174 grams with a glass front panel and plastic construction for durability. The phone supports dual SIM (Nano-SIM) operation along with Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.2 A2DP, FM radio, microUSB connectivity, but lacks NFC technology; it also has GPS positioning capabilities through its built-in system and includes a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor for added security. The device was announced in September 2020 and became available to the public on October 5th of that same year.

The Lava Blaze 5G is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE and full-fledged 5G capabilities with support for bands ranging from 900 to 41 MHz. Announced in October 2022, it was released on October 24 of the same year. The device boasts a hybrid dual SIM (Nano-SIM) system and weighs approximately 7.30 ounces with dimensions of 6.51 inches diagonally by 8.9 mm in thickness, offering an IPS LCD display that operates at 90Hz for smooth visual experiences. It runs on Android 12 powered by Mediatek MT6833 Dimensity 700 chipset with a quad-core CPU and Cortex A55 & A76 cores, alongside an Adreno GPU from the Mali series. The phone comes equipped with either 4GB or 6GB of RAM in its internal storage options and has dual cameras on the rear: a primary 50 MP wide camera complemented by two additional lenses for macro/close-up photography, all featuring HDR capabilities and LED flash support. Additionally, it offers frontal single-camera setup with an 8MP sensor capable of recording in 1080p at 30fps video quality. The Lava Blaze 5G also includes WLAN (Wi-Fi b/g/n/ac), Bluetooth 5.0, and FM radio for communication needs but lacks NFC technology; it charges via a non-removable LiPo battery with up to 10W wired charging capacity. Available in green or blue colors at the price of Rs. 9298, this device is part of LXX503 models and comes packed with various sensors including fingerprint recognition for security as well as an accelerometer and proximity sensor to detect orientation changes and presence nearby objects respectively.

The Haier L7 smartphone boasts a robust design with dimensions of 152 x 76 x 7.9 mm and weighs approximately 160 grams (5.64 oz). It features an IPS LCD display screen measuring 5.5 inches in size, offering resolution details at 1080x1920 pixels with a nearly square aspect ratio of about 72.2%. The device operates on Android 7.1 (Nougat) and is powered by the Qualcomm MSM8937 Snapdragon 430 chipset, paired with an octa-core CPU running at a frequency of up to 1.4 GHz Cortex-A53 processors alongside Adreno 505 GPU for graphics rendering. Storage is dual and comes in the form of microSDXC cards that share space within the SIM slot, providing access to an internal capacity of 32GB with a RAM size of 3GB. The Haier L7 includes two cameras: a single main camera module rated at 13MP for high-quality photos and videos up to 1080p resolution, complemented by another lone selfie camera capable of capturing images in 5MP quality with LED flash support. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.0 A2DP and LE for audio streaming purposes, while the device also supports GPS and GLONASS positioning systems but lacks NFC capabilities. The smartphone is equipped with a Li-Ion battery of approximately 3000mAh capacity that can be charged at up to 18W using Quick Charge technology (QC3).

The XOLO Black is an Android smartphone with a sleek black design and measures approximately 155.5 mm by 76.6 mm (6.12 x 3.02 inches) in size, featuring Gorilla Glass 3 on both its front and back surfaces along with an aluminum frame for durability. It comes equipped with a robust IPS LCD display that boasts a resolution of 1080x1920 pixels ensuring high-quality visuals within the ~403 ppi density, covering about 69.3% screen-to-body ratio and sized at 5.5 inches diagonally across. The device operates on Android 5.0 Lollipop with HIVE Atlas UI for a user-friendly interface experience powered by the Qualcomm MSM8939 Snapdragon 615 chipset, offering an octa-core CPU and Adreno 405 GPU to handle multitasking efficiently. Storage is provided via microSDHC with up to 32GB available through a shared slot alongside internal memory of 16GB, complemented by dual SIM capabilities for flexibility in connectivity options including GSM bands (850/900/1800) and HSPA+ Dual-band LTE Cat4. The smartphone's main camera system offers a powerful 13MP primary sensor with an additional AF2 MP, featuring LED flash for low light photography, panorama mode, and HDR video recording at 1080p@30fps quality. It also includes selfie capabilities through a single 5MP front-facing camera equipped with its own LED flash. The XOLO Black supports various communication standards such as Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.0, and A2DP for audio streaming; it also has GPS, GLONASS positioning systems but lacks NFC technology. Battery life is substantial with a non-removable LiPo battery rated at 3200mAh providing up to 736 hours of standby time on 2G networks and approximately half that duration for 3G, while the device was announced in July 2015 but has since been discontinued. Priced around 180 EUR at launch, it offers a combination of modern technology with its dual SIM functionality across multiple network bands including GSM, HSPA+ and LTE frequencies for extensive connectivity options.

The Philips V787 is an Android-based smartphone with a dual SIM capability and operates on Android 5.1 Lollipop OS system powered by an Octa-core CPU running at 1.3 GHz speed. It features a large IPS LCD display measuring 5.0 inches in size, offering a resolution of 1080x1920 pixels with approximately a 67.3% screen-to-body ratio for clear visuals and video playback at 1080p quality. The device boasts dual cameras: one main camera sensor rated at 13 MP with autofocus, complemented by a single selfie camera of 5 MP (video capabilities are not specified). Connectivity options include Wi-Fi standards up to and including ac for high speed data transfer as well as Bluetooth 4.0 A2DP technology; however, it lacks NFC functionality but does have FM radio capability along with a microUSB 2.0 port for charging or connectivity purposes. The phone supports GSM/HSPA and LTE networks across multiple bands including both SIM slots (GSM at various frequencies) as well as HSDPA, reaching speeds up to 50 Mbps with Cat4 LTE technology. It has a Li-Ion battery of approximately 5000 mAh capacity for extended use and comes in black color. The device was announced in December 2015 but is now discontinued since its release that same month, along with dimensions measuring roughly 143 x 71.6 mm by 9.8 mm (about an inch thick) and weighing around 164 grams or approximately 5.78 oz.

The Amoi WMA8508 is a mobile phone with GSM/UMTS technology supporting both GSM 900 and UMTS 2100 bands, announced in August of 2007. It has dimensions of 95 x 48 x 15.9 mm (3.74 x 1.89 x 0.63 inches) with a weight not specified but equipped with a mini-SIM card slot for network connectivity. The device features a TFT display that boasts 2.0 inches in size and supports up to 12.6 cm², offering a resolution of 176x220 pixels at approximately 141 ppi density, along with an external OLED screen displaying additional information or media content through its own separate 128 x 36 pixel display. The phone comes with internal memory capable of storing up to 500 entries in the address book and can handle a maximum of 20 dialed calls, received calls, and missed call alerts simultaneously due to its single-camera setup featuring a 1.3 MP sensor without video capabilities. It also includes basic communication features such as SMS, MMS, email services through WAP 2.0 browser support, along with Java functionality for games via the MIDP 2.0 platform and audio/player P2P Video Support alongside PC synchronization options. The Amoi WMA8508 is powered by a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 780 mAh capacity to ensure adethy operation throughout its use, with the phone available in black color scheme for various preferences and comes without built-in loudspeaker or external OLED display. Unfortunately, despite these features, it's important to note that this model has been cancelled since its announcement seven years ago.

The Blackview Tab 80 is a modern Android tablet featuring an IPS LCD display with dimensions of 10.1 inches and resolution at 800x1280 pixels, offering approximately 78.7% screen-to-body ratio for immersive visuals. It operates on the latest Doke OS_P version 3.0 based Android platform running on a Unisoc T606 chipset with an octa-core CPU comprising of two Cortex-A75 and six Cortex-A55 cores, paired with Mali-G57 MP1 GPU for efficient processing tasks. The device supports various network technologies including GSM/HSPA/LTE as well as dual SIM Nano-SIM functionality (GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 bands) and HSDPA on the 900 band, with additional support for LTE across multiple frequency bands. Weighing in at around 484 grams, it has a compact design measuring 241 x 156 x 7.5 mm (9.49 x 6.14 x 0.30 inches) and comes with internal storage options of either 64GB or up to 128GB paired with between 4-8GB RAM, depending on the configuration chosen. The tablet is equipped with a dual main camera system featuring one primary sensor rated at 13MP for high-quality photography and an additional unspecified secondary camera capable of recording video in 1080p up to 30fps quality. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0 with A2DP, FM Radio, USB Type-C OTG support, but it lacks NFC and GPS capabilities; however, the device does have a Li-Ion battery of 7680mAh capacity that supports fast wired charging at up to 10W. Available since its announcement in September 2023, this tablet comes in Grey, Blue, or Green color schemes and is powered by Android OS with a choice between different internal memory configurations ranging from 4GB RAM paired with either 64GB storage up to an impressive combination of 128GB storage and 8GB RAM.

The Energizer Ultimate U608s is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA and LTE technology with dual SIM support for both Nano-SIM cards (1x and standby). It was announced in June of 2022 and has been available since July the same year. The device boasts an Android 12 operating system based on Go edition, powered by Mediatek MT6761 Helio A22 chipset with a quad-core CPU running at 2.0 GHz Cortex-A53 and PowerVR GPU for graphics processing. The smartphone has an internal memory of 32GB storage paired with 2GB RAM, expandable via microSDXC card slot or eMMC 5.1 technology. It is equipped with a single main camera sensor rated at 5MP and capable of recording videos in 1080p resolution up to 60 frames per second (fps), complemented by another selfie camera also offering 5MP photos at 720p quality. The device measures approximately 155.4 x 73.3 mm with a weight of around 156.8 grams and comes in black, priced roughly at 90 EUR. Additionally, it includes WLAN (Wi-Fi b/g/n), Bluetooth 4.2 A2DP for wireless audio streaming, microUSB connectivity, a built-in loudspeaker, but lacks NFC and FM radio capabilities.

The BenQ E53 smartphone boasts a TFT display with 2.0 inches and supports up to 176x220 pixels resolution, offering vibrant colors through its dedicated microSD card slot for additional storage needs. It features a single-camera setup capable of capturing photos at 1.3MP quality and recording videos as well. The device operates on GSM/UMTS networks with support across multiple bands including both lower (900 MHz) and higher frequencies, providing connectivity options in various regions. Weighing approximately 90 grams, the BenQ E53 has a compact design measuring just over three inches diagonally by nearly four inches wide and one-seventeen millimeters thick with dimensions of 93mm x 47mm. The phone includes basic communication features such as SMS, email services (MIDP 2.0), Java for gaming applications, along with WAP 2.0/xHTML browser support. Notably, it has a removable Li-Ion battery rated at 900mAh capacity and can operate on wallpapers or an external OLED display via its secondary screen feature.

The Infinix Note 30 VIP is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE and full-fledged 5G capabilities with support for multiple frequency bands across various technologies including dual SIM options. Launched in June 2023, it boasts an impressive array of specifications on Android OS powered by XOS 13, running on a Mediatek MT6893 Dimensity 8050 chipset with Octa-core CPU and Mali-G77 MC9 GPU for smooth performance. The device comes in three different internal memory configurations: options of 256GB storage paired with either 8 or 12GB RAM, available at approximately 280 EUR each. Its display is a vibrant AMOLED screen offering high resolution and refresh rates up to 90Hz for fluid visuals while the main camera system includes a powerful triple-lens setup capable of capturing in both 4K and Full HD video quality, with additional features like HDR and panorama. The phone is built around glass front and plastic frame construction with dust and splash resistance where applicable, weighing about 190 grams for portability. It also includes a dual-lens selfie camera capable of taking high-quality photos at up to 32MP resolutions and comes equipped with various connectivity options such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC (where available), FM radio, USB Type-C OTG support, along with an impressive Li-Po battery rated for fast charging speeds.

The XOLO Black 1X is a discontinued mobile device with Android 5.1 Lollipop operating system and upgradable to version 6.0 Marshmallow, featuring Mediatek MT6753 chipset for processing power along with an Octa-core CPU running at 1.3 GHz Cortex-A53 and a Mali-T720MP3 GPU for graphics rendering. It boasts dual SIM capabilities through its hybrid design, supporting various network technologies including GSM/EDGE (850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 bands), HSPA+ with speeds up to 42.2/7.2 Mbps and LTE Cat4 offering downstreams of up to 150/50 Mbps on specific frequency bands, including TD-LTE at 1800 MHz. The device measures approximately 144.6 x 72 x 7.6 mm with a screen that covers about 66.2% of the body surface area and has an IPS LCD display resolution of 1080x1920 pixels, ensuring sharp visuals in its black color scheme. With internal storage options up to 32GB and expandable via microSDXC card slot using a shared SIM slot for additional memory, the phone is equipped with an on-board 3 GB of RAM which supports multitasking capabilities effectively. The device's main camera module offers a single 13 MP sensor paired with LED flash technology and panorama/HDR features while its selfie camera has a simpler 5 MP lens, both utilizing the same accelerometer, gyro, proximity, and compass sensors for orientation. Powered by a non-removable Li-Po battery of 2400 mAh capacity providing up to 394 hours standby time on GSM networks or about 12 hours on LTE connections with talk times extending accordingly; it also includes Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0 A2DP and dual SIM technology for connectivity flexibility. The phone's dimensions are not specified but its weight is unlisted in the provided data set.

The Soul X7 Pro by Allview is a modern smartphone featuring GSM/HSPA/LTE technology supporting multiple bands including both SIM and dual stand-by for Nano-SIMs (GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900). Announced in May 2020, it has been available since its release on the same date. The device boasts an IPS LCD display with a size of 6.53 inches and resolutions up to 4K at 30fps for video recording capabilities. It is powered by Android 9.0 (Pie) running on Qualcomm SDM630 Snapdragon 630 chipset, offering an octa-core CPU with Cortex-A53 and Adreno 508 GPU acceleration. The phone comes equipped with a dual rear camera system consisting of two main sensors (13MP wide angle) and one ultrawide sensor (8MP), along with macro capabilities for detailed close-ups, all protected by Gorilla Glass. With an internal storage capacity of 64GB and expandable via microSDXC card up to the shared SIM slot, it also has a substantial 4000mAh Li-Po battery supporting fast wired charging at 18W for extended use between charges. The device is available in black with an average Specific Absorption Rate (SAR) of 1.12 W/kg and retails around 230 EUR, making it a solid choice within its price range considering the specifications provided.

The Google Pixel Fold is a cutting-edge foldable smartphone featuring an OLED display with HDR10+ and up to 1450 nits brightness when unfolded at dimensions of 7.6 inches by 183.3 cm², offering a resolution of 1840 x 2208 pixels for sharp visuals, backed by Android OS version 13 with potential upgrade options up to Android 14 and powered by the Google Tensor G2 chipset: an octa-core processor comprising two Cortex-X1 high performance cores at 2.85GHz alongside four Cortex-A78 efficiency cores running at 1.80GHz, with Mali-G710 MP7 GPU for graphics processing. It boasts a substantial internal memory configuration of up to 256GB and 12GB RAM via UFS 3.1 storage technology. The device supports dual Nano-SIMs or an eSIM system along with WLAN, Bluetooth 5.2 (with A2DP, LE, aptX HD), Wi-Fi tri-band capabilities including the latest IEEE standards and GPS for location services integrated with GLONASS, BDS, and Galileo positioning systems as well as NFC technology. The main camera system is a versatile triple setup featuring 48MP wide, 10.8MP telephoto (with optical zoom), and an additional 8MP front sensor used for selfies or depth-sensitive actions like panoramas; it also supports video recording at various frame rates up to 4K resolutions with HDR capabilities. Weighing in at approximately 283 grams, the device is constructed of Gorilla Glass Victus on both its front and back along with an aluminum body structure for durability, while a Li-Po battery provides non-removable power storage rated at 4821mAh. Available in Porcelain or Obsidian colors, the Pixel Fold is priced from €1,849.42 to $899.99 and comes with a range of connectivity options including Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC, GPS, and USB Type-C for OTG functionality.

The Casio G'zOne Ravine (ID: casio_g_zone_4553) features a TFT display with 2.2 inches and resolution of 240x320 pixels in a 4:3 ratio, offering vibrant colors through its dedicated screen-to-body ratio. It operates on CDMA/EVDO technology supporting both CDMA 800 / 1900 bands and CDMA2000 1xEV-DO networks with speeds up to Rev.A of EV-DO at 3.1 Mbps, as announced in October 2010 upon its release that year but has since been discontinued. The device boasts a dust and water resistance rating (IP67) along with compliance to military standards like the MIL-STD-810F, making it durable for outdoor use. It includes an internal single 3.15 MP camera equipped with AF capabilities and LED flash as well as video recording functionality. The phone comes with a dedicated microSD card slot capable of housing up to 1000 entries in the contact list or Photocall, has built-in memory for call records storage, and is powered by an internal Li-Ion battery ranging from 512MB to 1600mAh depending on usage. Notably absent are WLAN capabilities but it does support Bluetooth with A2DP and EDR standards through a microUSB connection for audio peripherals, along with basic messaging options like SMS(threaded view), MMS, Email; however, Java is not supported nor do the device have social networking integration.
